number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
												First of all, this is an MMO -- so it suffers from the usual MMO problems such as network lag, grinding and cash shop.However, as far as MMOs go, it's actually quite good. The story writing is surprising for an MMO, and they hand out experience generously -- there is no penalty for advancing in the game, and you keep getting progress no matter what. Most of the game can be soloed, although you'll probably hit a problem or two along the way, especially if you don't have dungeon- or cash-gear. Still, it feels much less penalizing for me than other MMO"RP"Gs did.The progress itself is extremely fast, but feels very slow -- while you have hundreds of "abilities" that you can get, and points just keep rushing in, you can only ever equip 7 (or 8, if you count the special aux weapon ability). So, for the most part, you'll just spend your points on abilities that you'll never use, which fills up your ability wheel but doesn't change the game.Same goes for weapon skills -- most of the time you'll just advance weapons that you don't use, because you've already maxed out the weapons that you do use... so, again, spending points all the time for only cosmetic progress as your skill bars fill up and the game stays the same.If you have access to good gear then you're probably running dungeons. Since you can get all abilities and use all weapons, you're not locked into a specific role (like DPS, healer or tank) --instead, just get suitable gear for each role, get familiar with a set of abilities useful for that role, and you can just switch your setup whenever you want.Bottom line -- it's still an MMO, but one that feels recommendable enough. It's definitely not a "thumbs down".

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 28, 2013
												If you ignore the click-click-click combat, the strangers spouting specialized acronyms, the clutter of semi-opaque inventory windows... you will find puzzles. Glorious puzzles. And when I say puzzles, I mean it in the true sense of the word: these are enigmas designed to test your ingenuity. You will need to pay attention, write things down, reasearch, translate, sketch, stretch, shower, stew, contemplate, contemplate, contemplate, and even then you might not be able to put everything together. But when you do, oh! Such a sense of accomplishment. I have never experienced a game as stimulating and rewarding as this.

												If you ignore the click-click-click combat, the strangers spouting specialized acronyms, the clutter of semi-opaque inventory windows... you will find puzzles. Glorious puzzles. And when I say puzzles, I mean it in the true sense of the word: these are enigmas designed to test your ingenuity. You will need to pay attention, write things down, reasearch, translate, sketch, stretch, shower, stew, contemplate, contemplate, contemplate, and even then you might not be able to put everything together. But when you do, oh! Such a sense of accomplishment. I have never experienced a game as stimulating and rewarding as this.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
												First of all, this is an MMO -- so it suffers from the usual MMO problems such as network lag, grinding and cash shop.However, as far as MMOs go, it's actually quite good. The story writing is surprising for an MMO, and they hand out experience generously -- there is no penalty for advancing in the game, and you keep getting progress no matter what. Most of the game can be soloed, although you'll probably hit a problem or two along the way, especially if you don't have dungeon- or cash-gear. Still, it feels much less penalizing for me than other MMO"RP"Gs did.The progress itself is extremely fast, but feels very slow -- while you have hundreds of "abilities" that you can get, and points just keep rushing in, you can only ever equip 7 (or 8, if you count the special aux weapon ability). So, for the most part, you'll just spend your points on abilities that you'll never use, which fills up your ability wheel but doesn't change the game.Same goes for weapon skills -- most of the time you'll just advance weapons that you don't use, because you've already maxed out the weapons that you do use... so, again, spending points all the time for only cosmetic progress as your skill bars fill up and the game stays the same.If you have access to good gear then you're probably running dungeons. Since you can get all abilities and use all weapons, you're not locked into a specific role (like DPS, healer or tank) --instead, just get suitable gear for each role, get familiar with a set of abilities useful for that role, and you can just switch your setup whenever you want.Bottom line -- it's still an MMO, but one that feels recommendable enough. It's definitely not a "thumbs down".

content:
Posted: April 7
												I throughly Enjoy this game once in awhile, I played it alot just when it was released, ran Endgame content, which, while buggy as hell, was fun to do, Abilities, Spells, Passives, and Aux weapons are all fun to play with and make weird crazy synergies, and quite honestly, if it weren't because I mostly play games with friends to have fun, and none of them seems to like this game, I'd probably have more then 5000 hours by now.The story is pretty catchy if you actually read into the quests, or just watch the cutscenes unfold, there are some funny and some interresting NPCs and characters in general, I like the gear system, and loved the Fashion system, you can look however you want and not have it mess with stats at all, and planning and synergizing skill and strategies with allies in Dungeons, and Raids, aswell as Nightmare areas, are really fun, (though you do get groups that don't communicate at all, but that's the same in all games).The UI is wank, and the game is still to this day riddled with bugs, though it's alot less bad then during release, and getting higher up in gear level can be tedious to start with, but it has alot of good qualities that overshadow its flaws for me, and what problems the game has, I can live with.Would I recommend this game to people?Well, ask yourself, do you like a deep skill system can allows synergies between weapons and spells you didn't even realise were there? Yes? WellDo you bother following the narative of a games story as you progress through it? Yes?Do you like quests that challenge you, not nessesarily your character in the game, but you as a player, that have to sit down and actually do some research to get on with certain quests? Yes to this too?Well does the game being buggy at times put you off, that said alot of it is minor now, and you can usualy work around it? If it doesn't put you off from a game, then absolutly I'd recommend it! It's a great game and very fun to mess with, Builds, Dungeons, and some pretty interresting quets await ahead in this game.All this said, I'll mention that the game does have PvP, but I'm not much of a PvP'er so I've barely touched it, it seemed okayish to me, but my guess it that there are probably 2-5 builds that completely dominate the PvP Areas, and that if you don't play those that you won't do too well, but I don't know for sure, this review is all from the PvE aspect of the game for me.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
												The story is something I'd like to see. I wish there were more MMOs with a horror theme and a real-world setting.But this is one I cannot enjoy. There's a lot of 'stealth' and timing elements that are very hard, impossible for me. There's a lot of frustration looking for well-hidden and hard to find objects. Every mission is repeatable and I find myself doing the same ones over and over instead of finding new ones. It gets boring.Combat is weak compared to other MMO games and the character development system gives the illusion of free will but really traps you into buying a set of skills with synergies or else having a terribly innefective character.It's hard to get a group together and the world looks vacant with very few other players.I'm disappointed in my purchase and will be going back to LotRO. That being said, I'm sure there' an audience for this game. Just be aware that it's got a very high element of a scavenger hunt. It's complicated, rather than complex, and a lot of times it's east to be totally lost as to where to go or what to do next.

content:
Posted: March 1
												There're no good nor bad MMOs. Every MMO is tailored for different kind of people, some MMOs focus on storytelling, some on good combat, role-playing, trading and crafting. I never recommend MMOs, I just say what I like/dislike, because in the end, it's all about personal preferences. I gotta say that The Secret World is a pretty good game. But I did not like it.I've played the game for 10ish hours, which is not nearly enough to fully understand an MMO, but it's enough to grasp the basics and realize if I like the game or not.Let me tell you how I felt during my time playing.So right after I clicked the character creation button, 3 factions popped up - Illuminati, Templars, Dragon (which is some Chinese organization?) - and I got to see a video for each one, showing me what's their ideology. I picked Illumati as they seemed the most appealing to me. Cinematic rolls in, recapitulating what happened during the last week. Long story short - a bee flew in my mouth, gave me super powers and apparently now some weird energy bursts out of me from time to time (not in a sexual way). Alright, the story is a little bit odd, but let's run with it. After 10 mins of high-quality cinematic experience, I have sudden need to go pick my laundry. I meet this Russian guy, let's call him cousin Roman - and he tells me he's being watched by the Illuminati, I look around and soon find their base located nearby in an old building (not so super secret afterall eh?). All of a sudden I'm being dragged by some guys, screen goes dark and when I wake up, an Einstein-looking mofo greets me, I go through briefing and finally get to weapon selection room, where I picked two of 9 possible weapons. Up until now I was actually fine with what was happening, despite the fact that the story might not be the best one ever. What really throws me off is how all the weapon animations and poses look like - one of the main things, that make me interested in an MMO, is how I feel when playing my character - it doesn't matter whether I play as a cute anime chick or a muscular man. Or a muscular anime chick. Whatever it is, I just want to feel like a bonafide badass and The Secret World has the exact opposite effect - I made a pretty cool-looking character, but after I got to try out the weapons, I felt like a cringey, awkward neckbeard weaboo warrior. The pistols don't even aim at their target, I just shoot them in random directions and the bullets land regardless, the swords remind me of The Blade[imgur.com] meme and the magic... why even put magic in such a mature, modern world? It's all such an odd mashup, as if the developer was trying to put in as many different combat styles as possible, but I really don't think it's necessary.Alright, weird story and awkward animations, I can live with that. After that I went through a portal thingy and got ported into a heaven-like place with a bunch of giants chilling around. Scratch the mature, modern world, forget I ever said that. We full fantasy now. I went through another portal and found myself in a post-apocalyptic world, where human survivors fight zombies and finally got a taste of combat, gotta say it was a bitter taste. At this point I have 4 abilities, 2 for each weapon type, which would be fine, if only there was at least some synergy between them - but there wasn't. I could mash the same single-target button, switch it out with an aoe button from time to time, but I didn't feel like it makes any difference. Also my buttons felt unresponsive, like every ability needs to finish its animation before I can do stuff, which I'm not a fan of either. As my next ability, I picked a drone, not only did it not synergize with my kit at all, it also seemed to be completely useless. This combat just doesn't make me feel like a badass at all, it makes me feel lame, slow and bored. It's just not fluid enough, not fun for me. Instead of being a god among humans, I'm a weaboo neckbeard gun-wielding ninja warrior.I really like the quest system, you can find quests pretty much wherever you go, no giant exclamation marks above NPC heads, you just talk to them, or find a random item laying around in the world and voilá quest started. I also gotta compliment the crafting system, which involves disassembling and assembling all kinds of items. Character customization is also well done and the game doesn't seem to be pay-to-win. However, I can't play without a combat system that I'd enjoy, that's the dealbreaker for me.Ever since WoW's Cataclysm, I've been desperately trying to find an MMO that would fit my tastes, played over 25 different ones. Is The Secret World "the one"? Unlikely. I might give it another shot, perhaps the combat gets better eventually, but at this point I say no, I still like WoW more, even though I don't really like it. Gotta love WoW. And hate it. Eat donkey d, Blizzard.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2016
												Amazing game. It's an MMO that plays like a single player game, and the atmosphere and lore are incredibly immersive and detailed. I read that, in some areas, you will hardly ever see any other players (by design) in order to enhance the player's immersion in the environment. Pretty kickass. The Ultimate Edition is a great deal in terms of value, so if you're thinking about buying TSW and wondering which version to get, pick the Ultimate Edition. You'll save a bunch of money on the other issues (storylines) in the long run: you get issues 1-4 with the base game, but you get issues 1-11 with the Ultimate Edition. You also get 30 days of membership, 1200 bonus Funcom points (which you can use to buy issue 12 or 13 if you felt like it), an exclusive outfit, some other items, and a bonus game key for the standard edition of the game that you can give to a friend. It really is worth it to get the Ultimate Edition over the base game.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
Review - some tips for upgrading at the endI am an MMO Snob.   What does this mean?   I love the idea of MMOs and have loved the idea since it first was given a name (I beta tested Ultima Online).    However, I am really picky about game play and the vast majority of MMOs because of how the stories and quests are laid out I believe I would prefer as single player.   Like I said a snob.The Secret WorldIs an exception for me.   It uses similar MMO mechanics, but the way the story is laid out and the reasoning behind why there are many of people running around just works for me in this MMO.   Also it has a one of a kind atmosphere and story.   If you are a fan of Horror, Urban Fantasy, Conspiracy Theories, Urban Legends, and the Supernatural then this MMO has all of that.   There is no other game out there (including single player) that quite catches this atmosphere.   I'd love to play some of those if they existed.This MMO can be played solo for the most part, or with a group.   There are some side DUNGEONS that you need to group up to play (they are cool) but, they are optional.The game has basically three varieties of quests.   It has your standard quests you'd expect from MMOs with killing something, fetching something, delivering something , etc.It has sneaky quests where the goal is to destroy or sneak around.It has these puzzle quests... and yes they are TOUGH and intended to be so.   Many of them you couldn't solve on your own unless you happened to be a genius biblical scholar.   However, the game has a browser built in or you can even launch a browser outside of the game.   It is intended that you use web pages and such to help you solve these puzzles.   They are COOL.   I doubt anyone could solve them all without searching the web.   There are also numerous sites offering walk throughs that are helpful in this.   You can pound at them and try to solve them and then when you start to get frustrated enough you are thinking about stopping go hit a walk thru and continue on, or you can use the Walkthroughs to power through these quests and still experience the story and vicariously feel as though you solved them.   It leaves this to the player's choice, so they work well.They recently updated the game so special currency you could only earn through PvP you can get just playing the game in general.   This is used to purchase nifty special items.If you hate MMO mechanics that might wear on you like it does for me.If the atmosphere and story appeal to you though you may find that it is easy to overlook that like it is for me.UPGRADING EXISTING ACCOUNTSOnce you purchase this you'll get a new steam key.I get the key by going to LIBRARY then GAMES then Right click on The Secret World and click View CD Keys.   Click on the ulitmate edition.   Click copy to clipboard.   Go to the Secret World website and login to your account.   In the lower left corner is a KEY REGISTRATION area... put this key there and click register... then scroll to the bottom of the page again and tell it GO to apply it to your account... then scroll to the bottom again and click CONFIRM.   You can then purchase any of this stuff for 0 in the in game store.My older ReviewThe mechanics in this game are not anything earth shattering.   If I were basing this review on that alone this would get a downvote from me.   However, it has a very cool atmosphere, and a great story.   It is unique from that perspective and in my opinion is worth the price of entry just to enjoy some of the environments and stories.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												This game is AWESOME! It's quite emmersive. There are 3 types of quests. Main quests, side quests, and small quests. Main quests and side quests consist 3 types of quests, Action quest (the usual fighting stuff except most of the time you have good reason to do it), Sabatoge quests (these are inflitrating something, usually an underground hideout, or some sort of enemy related building, and well.... you sabatoge it with various things to do), and Investigation missions (these are what seperates the secret world from everything else. Basically it's an ARG where you have to find clues, solve puzzles, and investigate things both in and out of the game with reasearch via google and books). Small quests are just small things like go from point A to point B and do something or fight these monsters. The more generic quests. And every quest besides small quests have a fully voiced cinematic cut scene. Combat is very free and open. The only downside that's preventing me from playing right now is that I don't have anyone friends who play it and the game is significantly better with friends. #4EverAlone :(

content:
Posted: June 24, 2013
												TSW has the most original and innovative approach towards online gaming I have personally expierenced. With missions running the gamut from killing "X amount of zombies" to "recreate this missing classical score"(or else it gets the poison again!), and even solving riddles told entirely in base 10; there is truely somthi ng for everyone. TSW is a magnificent adventure to be had, but truth be told, some of the puzzles are insinely overcomplicated... and thats where playing with friends really makes this title shine. If you play regularly in a group, this is not to be missed.p.s.all investigations work on the honor system, no cheatsies!

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												I have played through much of the starting area and I have to say that it is one of the most innovative MMMOs I have ever played. It is uniquely story-driven compared to many other MMOs that have story elements tacked onto fighting in order to level up. Of course, with any MMO one aspect is to see your character advance. The Secret World is no different but FunCom has somehow removed the grinding elements. You can learn any skill and max it out if you wish—so there's very little sense that you can ever screw up and select an "unworkable build". Instead, you take the abilities you've learn and configure them so that they work well together. No re-spec is necessary. Gear is important, but not absolute, and its readily available.If you're the sort of person that "wants to love their MMO" but somehow just quits without ever going very far, this may be the game for you. Now that it is subscription free like Guild Wars 2, playing is a one time investment. There is a real world store but it sells consumables and cosmetics which are unnecessary. There are even ways within the game to get new outfits without spending any real world cash.If this goes on sale at Steam, I heartily reccomend it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												There would have been a time when I would have not recommended The Secret World; always a conceptual marvel, beautifully told and voice-acted through episodic adventures, but hampered though combat too clunky and obtuse to prevail over its ridiculously harsh difficulty scaling.This has since changed, a complete rebalancing of mobs and streamlining of its combat system allowing the game to finally play to all its collective strengths; the storytelling, music, atmosphere, freedom of choice, art direction, wardrobe system, lack of handholding... it's all still there, no longer burdened by everything in between.This of course raises an important question: is The Secret World still an archaic behemoth true to Funcom's mixed legacy? Well... yes, but consider it a massively more intuitive one as of my recent revisiting -- a fan without question.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												Simply put: Don't buy the game standalone.  I don't mean don't buy the game, I mean don't buy THIS particular version of the game.  The Ultimate Bundle is what you actually want to buy.  Why?  Because the Ultimate Bundle comes preloaded with almost all of the expansions for the game (you'll also get $10 worth of Funcom Points upon completing your first 30 quests; I recommend using this to buy Issue #12).If you buy this there is no upgrade option, you'll end up having to buy the Ultimate Bundle which is basically buying the game twice.  Either that or you can buy the expansions if you want, but that'll cost you more than just buying the Ultimate Edition.  So in summary, the game itself is GREAT, I absolutely recommend it.  But buy the Ultimate Edition so you won't end up having to buy it twice, and you'll save a bunch of money on the expansions!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												the secret world or, tsw as it is known by its ever growing fan base, is a free to play open world rpg adventure game. I looked into this when i got tired of fps games, and endeavored to find something different to indulge my minds ever yearning need to be placated. no easy task i can assure you, but tsw hits the mark, it has a story line which will take you from the gloomy rural outskirts of kingston town all the way to the frozen warewolf ridden hell of transilvania, along the way you will run through, tombs, deserts, hidden tree fortresses, grave yards, and encampments of npcs ready to guide you on your way as you journey through the vast and diverse landscape that is the secret world. the story line itself is complex, and if you fail to watch part of it you will find yourself wondering what is going on throughout the rest of the game, but then half the fun of this game is that you do actually learn from it, and its maturity level is fairly high, unless you have an iq of 140 and consider yourself to be "quite the historian" or your primary place of residence is in a library i doubt that you will get all of the obscure historical references left by the game on hand, and will more than likely have to do a bit of light reading before it all starts to take form. to be fair, I think i learned more from this game about ancient european history and folklore than i did in school. you will also find that unless you have that knowledge you will probably be looking up solutions to quests online quite frequently, i know very few people that can speak all the languages that you would need to know to even begin to fathom what the quest is asking you to do. but that doesnt really work against it, the game has a built in browser for exactly that purpose, which has been adjusted to provide search results that will only give you a clue as to the answer and not give the entire game away.they have obviously put alot of thought into it, and i liked that it took me a whole year to level up just to complete the main ability tree, it keeps you focused and goal oriented for a long time, even after you have finished the main story line, there are sub stories and seasonal stories constantly being released, plenty of which are free to play. id look into this one if you like adventure games, or rpgs, or massive online multiplayer games, and also enjoy an intellectual challenge, this might have what your looking for.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Hey all !Just want to put few words in here about this tittle. I have been playing MMORPG for over a decade now. Seen better and worst many times before. The secret world is definitely worth your attention if: you like horror climate in games, if you like freedom from start of the game, if you likke innovative ways to build and progress your character, if you dont mind progressing through most of the game on your own and dont mind spending lots of time looking for groups. Then this game is a perfect choice. Myself however i had a large issue with lack of group runs on the low level, i dont mean QL1 or 2 here i mean QL5 and above. Sadly there is no groups for new players, yes the Sanctuary chat is friendly and full of people but none of them is willing to do group runs below QL10 cause they dont get anything out of it. The facebook page is almost dead and apart from devs putting up the news there the response is very very little. Seem that the game is largely populated by high level players who dont bother with newbies. No LFG tool also does not help in this type of game as fresh players have no way to learn their class in group. Personally i think this takes a lot of good out of this game. MMORPG is all about teaming up with people and overcoming obstacle in groups and i am sad to say but you will not see this in here untill you waaaaay deep into the game and bored of feeling that you play another single player rpg.Iam recommending this game as a good game on its own but not for hard fans of team work.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
												Currently at Savage Coast.This game has a lot of mixed reviews, and for good reasons.I bought this game last year (I think) and it's sat uninstalled since the first time I played it. At the time, I couldn't figure out what I was doing because I was focussed on other stuff and couldn't be bothered trying to get into something new (my own fault, obviously).But anyway! Installed it recently again and I've got to say it's excellent in some ways. The story and overall concept is absolutely brilliant, I love it. Modern setting in a good looking environment and plenty of cool places for roleplaying. Unlike most MMORPGs (including Champions Online, which is a favourite), the questing doesn't feel linear at all. I haven't had two quests that have felt the same, and I've completed more than I can count. The combat is great fun aswell, though I would prefer it if this game was gamepad compatible. Still, other than that, no complaints really. Questing gets tough though, and you have to pick your upgrades carefully or you'll not enjoy your time. Playing with another person (preferably someone you know, who is an active player) is insanely good fun!The character customisation is great, appearance you might find a little limited. But then again, I say that after playing Champions Online which is simply insane when it comes to your character's appearance choices. Speaking of CO, this game is pretty much Free Form the whole way through. You're not stuck to any particular tree of abilities, and you can even (if you have the patience) keep going until you get enough skill/ability to points to unlock ALL the powers *insert raised torch* and alter your build however you please. It's pretty endless, and there seems to be new content every year which is really cool.The environments themselves look great, from London to Egypt this game offers some great adventure. The enemies are well designed and sometimes things get pretty spooky...also BIG THUMBS UP FOR VOICE ACTING!The loading times are...horrific, at least for me. Just logging in takes longer than you'd think necessary, and then switching from Agartha (probably didn't spell that properly!) to London is equally as irritating. Updates aswell...despite being able to get 1.9mb/s on Steam, the game launcher gives me an average of below 1mb/s and just goes up and down seemingly without end.Weapons/Talismens seem scarse. I've completed a lot of quests and so far only received one weapon (that I actually use with my powers). However, I found the auction house to be very helpful and the rare weapons you buy with tokens from completing quests in specific areas give you a great punch! The community has to be one of the best I've come across. Very helpful, there's always someone around to help out. The RP community is very good aswell, the TSWRP addon from Curse makes it very comfortable to create a character. The lore also is very clear so there's not much confusion to be found.Consumables are suprisingly fun, SMOKING A CIGAR HEALS YOU IN THIS GAME. Also, they're cheap (in the Horned God bar) which makes it handy for characters who want to have a shmok'! Great game for Roleplayers, great game for PVPers, great game overall with just a few flaws that can be overlooked with ease. Also, anyone calling this game "pay to win" has either not played the game at all or have some other reason to moan about a problem that doesn't exist in this game.8/10, may seem a bit of a high score considering the flaws but in this case the benefit SERIOUSLY outweighs the cost.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
Review - some tips for upgrading at the endI am an MMO Snob.   What does this mean?   I love the idea of MMOs and have loved the idea since it first was given a name (I beta tested Ultima Online).    However, I am really picky about game play and the vast majority of MMOs because of how the stories and quests are laid out I believe I would prefer as single player.   Like I said a snob.The Secret WorldIs an exception for me.   It uses similar MMO mechanics, but the way the story is laid out and the reasoning behind why there are many of people running around just works for me in this MMO.   Also it has a one of a kind atmosphere and story.   If you are a fan of Horror, Urban Fantasy, Conspiracy Theories, Urban Legends, and the Supernatural then this MMO has all of that.   There is no other game out there (including single player) that quite catches this atmosphere.   I'd love to play some of those if they existed.This MMO can be played solo for the most part, or with a group.   There are some side DUNGEONS that you need to group up to play (they are cool) but, they are optional.The game has basically three varieties of quests.   It has your standard quests you'd expect from MMOs with killing something, fetching something, delivering something , etc.It has sneaky quests where the goal is to destroy or sneak around.It has these puzzle quests... and yes they are TOUGH and intended to be so.   Many of them you couldn't solve on your own unless you happened to be a genius biblical scholar.   However, the game has a browser built in or you can even launch a browser outside of the game.   It is intended that you use web pages and such to help you solve these puzzles.   They are COOL.   I doubt anyone could solve them all without searching the web.   There are also numerous sites offering walk throughs that are helpful in this.   You can pound at them and try to solve them and then when you start to get frustrated enough you are thinking about stopping go hit a walk thru and continue on, or you can use the Walkthroughs to power through these quests and still experience the story and vicariously feel as though you solved them.   It leaves this to the player's choice, so they work well.They recently updated the game so special currency you could only earn through PvP you can get just playing the game in general.   This is used to purchase nifty special items.If you hate MMO mechanics that might wear on you like it does for me.If the atmosphere and story appeal to you though you may find that it is easy to overlook that like it is for me.UPGRADING EXISTING ACCOUNTSOnce you purchase this you'll get a new steam key.I get the key by going to LIBRARY then GAMES then Right click on The Secret World and click View CD Keys.   Click on the ulitmate edition.   Click copy to clipboard.   Go to the Secret World website and login to your account.   In the lower left corner is a KEY REGISTRATION area... put this key there and click register... then scroll to the bottom of the page again and tell it GO to apply it to your account... then scroll to the bottom again and click CONFIRM.   You can then purchase any of this stuff for 0 in the in game store.My older ReviewThe mechanics in this game are not anything earth shattering.   If I were basing this review on that alone this would get a downvote from me.   However, it has a very cool atmosphere, and a great story.   It is unique from that perspective and in my opinion is worth the price of entry just to enjoy some of the environments and stories.

												What i can say for now - Not a bad game. Combat system is crap, to be honest. Character customization is good from one side, but bad from other. Few faces to choose, few eyebrows, few lips and noses. Few skin colors and they are bad.Each face has its own preset colors. For example, face No1 can have white man skin color, but face No2 can have light brown as lightest color. No racism intended =).With clothing it is much better. You can wear T-shirt and vest above it.Two combat styles for character, your choice. Pistols, sword, chaos magic etc. Combine as you like.Best thing about this game is plot. How many MMO`s with plot you know?  Star Wars the Old Republic maybe? This game has voiced dialogues. It can be played alone and that is good. You don`t need to wait for group.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												TSW gives an interesting spin on the Fantasy genre by placing it in a modern setting rather than the classical Middle Ages theme.  It bares more resemblance to a Lovecraftian horror than a Tolkien work, dubbed by my friends "Call of Cthulu; the video game" (even if only few parts have sanity meter mechanics).Settings include a small town in New England overrun by undead, a city in Egypt fighting against a new uprising of one of its ancient foes, and a series of post-Soviet occupation Trannsylvanian towns besieged by vampires and werewolves.The foes run the gambit from classic design to compleately reimagined, whatever needed to fit into a modern setting.  Zombies in track suits, golems made of scrap metal, cultist in hoodies, and vampires covered in parkas and gas masks (to protect themselves from the sun, duh), scuttling wendigo, sloshing dragur, glowing will-o-wisps and more.Characters are distinct and memorable, with NPCs that will make you laugh audibly, cry physically, and moments that will make you go "what the f###?!?"  Every one of my friends who have played this game have a favorite, and a least favorite, character.  Dialogue is well written, better than some TV shows.Quests vary between standard assult and dungeon missions that require slaying of hordes of mosters (or one big one), sabotage missions that require tact and subterfuge, and research missions that involve extensive out-of-game study.I cannot emphasise the awesomeness of research missions enough; they are incredible in-depth puzzles and can make you do anything from learn arabic to visit game-based websites on the real world internet to scribble notes about demon runes like a madman.  The lazy can simply Google search for a walkthrough, but those who enjoy mystery will have a blast connecting the dots.As a MMO RPG, it still suffers the stanard MMO RPG flaws; other players mercing your tagets before you can reach them, small pools of active players looking for group for the dungeon you want to run, nessicerey grinding to become strong enough to handle the next area, player characters in gaudy outfits providing jarring contrast to the scenery, the silent protagonist, and so on.  However, these flaws don't detract significantly rom the game.When all is said and down, I would recomend this game to any fan of modern fantasy.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												I've played, or watched playthroughs of, many "Lovecraftian" games in the past, hoping to find something that got the right atmosphere without being overly shock-focused, overly gross-focused, or 3edgy5me.  I'm kinda annoyed with myself that I was not aware of The Secret World before, AND that it took me almost a year between buying it at a sale and finally trying it.  Seriously, wtf me? PROS:  This game is basically the tabletop RPG Call of Cthulhu, but in MMORPG mode.  It hits the atmosphere and puzzles just right without being overly tedious as far as the usual grinding quests go.  The monster designs are fabulous.  Don't just assume that everything is zombies (I know someone who tried the beta then ignored the final release because he assumed that!)  Once you get beyond the starter area the enemy diversity gets super interesting and the world building around them is amazing.  I've also never encountered puzzles like this, ones where you actually have to do real world research in order to figure things out instead of just clicking the shiny things in different orders until something happens. It's inspired me to make some additions to the tabletop game that I run!  The super nice thing is that the really difficult puzzles are just side quests, so you can choose how/when you take them on.  Also, the quest difficuly labels change as you increase your skills/weaponry which makes it a lot easier to choose what to do next.CONS: Unintuitive GUI.  Fortunately you won't be fiddling around with it excessively, but it can definitely make using consumables in a fight difficult.  The fighting itself gets to be rather repetitive and it can be difficult to switch targets, but honestly, they're just there to slow you down, increase the task difficulty and provide drops.  This is not a fight-centric game.  The communicty (at least at the lower levels where I still am) is also not very close-knit.  I haven't encountered any LFGs except for difficult dungeons, just people soloing.  On the other hand, I've had a lot more randoms just jump into a fight to help and then continue about their business once the trouble was over, so that's pretty cool.  I've seen some people mention that this game would have been better as just a regular RPG and I can't really argue with that at this time.OVERALL: the cons aren't nearly enough to keep me away from this game.  It's atmospheric enough to creep me out at times (beautiful sound design, omg) which is really difficult to do, challenging enough intellectually to keep my brain awake, great enough story telling that I've found myself wanting to steal them for my own games, humorous enough that I've taken screen shots for the first time in years, and so on and so on.BRB going to buy all the DLC

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												This is an amazing game that I hope everyone at least gives it a try. You get a free 10-day trial on their website to see if youll like it. The game has some of the best stories and I love that fact that every mission has its own fully voiced cutscenes with AAA voice acting. THe devs did not hold any punches when it come to giving The Secret World a super deep and really enjoyable setting ans story. Unlike all the other MMO's out there, this game makes you feel alone, all by yourself. You dont see all these random people running around killing enemies in front you you, crowing towns, ect. They do a great job of managing the servers to devide you up in your own little world. You will come across people here and there but its not common. But if your looking for people to play with, either it be randoms or not, all you do is use the chat and youll have people teleporting to you in no time. there is always tons of active players online at any given moment.The only thing i didnt like at first was the combat. it felt slow, clunky, ect. But i gave it a try and now I love it. Compaired to WOW, this combat is amazing. WOW is way clunkier and slow paced than TSW. So if you liked WOW, youll think this is a dream. I love the Fact that no matter what map of a map you are on, what area you headed, you always run into side missions, investagation missions, ect. At times youll see a few next to each other that you can activate and kill two birds with one stone since one is "kill X amount of creature" while the other was "Investgate X area" it doesnt happen to oftn but it feels good to get the xp very quickly in one clean swoop. Other games have you running all over the place and back again just to continue on the missions, not TSW. Once the mission was completed you just collect your rewards and xp. And also half of the XP earned will be given to you split up with each TIER of the mission. So if the Mission is 200k xp and is a 5 tier mission, you will get 25k per tier and on the last tier youll get the 100k thats left. You can also pause missions and do them at a later date while starting a ne wone and go back to where you left off, not worring about the lost time or XP. It does well for giving you what you earned.I can go on and on and on but im tired of typing and want to go play some more. If you are the slightest interested in the game, just go and install the free trial and give it a go.BTW, Still a great game

												While I feel this game has a myriad of flaws that would otherwise keep it from getting my recommendation, this game captured me in a way that no MMO ever had before. The environments are imaginitive, the characters are interesting, and the quests are some of the best I've experienced in any game, let alone an MMO. Mind you that you have to slog through a lot to get to that sweet core, but it's worth the time I've sunk into it and more.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2015
												(Don't let my playtime fool you, I've only spent about 8-10 real hours playing.)I've just recently gotten back into this game after a long hiatus and I've never really examined an mmo in such a way as I have with this one. I guess I'll just start: 1. The game definitely scores well when asked about its battle system and variety. There are plenty of skills to mix and match to create a versatile and powerful character. 2. Time = Success. Like most games, the only way you'll prosper is by spending time in the game and really cracking down on how you build your character.3. EXPLORATION/MYSTERY. It may seem trivial as I continue to explain this, but this game has a special component that makes it stand out when compared to other MMOs. Mystery Solving. Although some aren't very difficult to piece together, it takes a bit more effort than just simply reaching a destination to complete a quest. You must closely examine objects you receive during quests to complete certain puzzles correctly. ----------A short but sweet review. I am still actively playing this and I will change my review as I further experience the game.

Very unique game for folks not looking to grind out pick-up and deliver quests and raid group instances all the time. Very much enjoy this game and I hope the devs find a way out of their financial troubles as this game deserves even more support.Well worth checking out.M13

content:
Posted: January 2
												Tired of the same hand-holding quest system used in a majority of MMOs today?Want something different from the same old fantasy world?For the past four years, The Secret World has managed to be (to my knowledge) the only MMO in a modern-day setting filled with lore and a quest system that isn't afraid to assume you're able to solve riddles requiring the use of bibles and musician names.While Steam has good sales on the base game and Ultimate Editions, you'll usually get the most bang for your buck with the Complete Edition on the official Funcom site when they have sales (like Halloween, for example).

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												This is probably the only game in the world to frustrate me in a very specific manner.  I enjoy it, it's good, but I'm down right furious that it's not better.  The story and setting is my favorite in gaming and is incredibly immersive.  The actual gameplay however is either just OK or inscrutible.  For instance 95 hours in and I have virtually no idea what my stats do or if my build is good.  The story and the voice acting make up for everything though.  I'll always remember investigating on Solomon Island, or doing missions for the statues in Cairo.  This game should be better!  So it can be everywhere!Edit Feb. 2016 = I've purchased the lifetime sub before it went away, I love the story and presentation but most everything else is either passable to just terrible.  The game has given me an error EVERY time I log out.  Every third or so time I try to log in to the game it either get's stuck on the load screen or the program just ends.  The design of about ten percent of the missions will just infuriate you instead of challenge or engage you.  This game is wonderful by really old school PC standards but in this era of PC programming I expect better.

												This is probably the only game in the world to frustrate me in a very specific manner.  I enjoy it, it's good, but I'm down right furious that it's not better.  The story and setting is my favorite in gaming and is incredibly immersive.  The actual gameplay however is either just OK or inscrutible.  For instance 95 hours in and I have virtually no idea what my stats do or if my build is good.  The story and the voice acting make up for everything though.  I'll always remember investigating on Solomon Island, or doing missions for the statues in Cairo.  This game should be better!  So it can be everywhere!Edit Feb. 2016 = I've purchased the lifetime sub before it went away, I love the story and presentation but most everything else is either passable to just terrible.  The game has given me an error EVERY time I log out.  Every third or so time I try to log in to the game it either get's stuck on the load screen or the program just ends.  The design of about ten percent of the missions will just infuriate you instead of challenge or engage you.  This game is wonderful by really old school PC standards but in this era of PC programming I expect better.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												I have to say I really like this game. Having played multiple MMO's, what fascinates me about this one is it's simplicity. You don't need to spend years figuring out the best builds or the most successful mechanics. People who fancy the sophisticated stuff might dislike that, but I'm really into it.The atmosphere is pretty good (for an MMO at least), and different quest types like sabotage (sneaky-stuff) and investigation (use knowledge and research to solve complex riddles, some of them are really difficult, don't spoil them by cheating) increase the overall feel.Those of you familiar with the works of Lovecraft will find some resemblences in the game, something I'm highly enjoying (especially since I feel there's way too few Lovecraft-themed games out there).It might not have the larges community, the fanciest graphics or the most complex system, but this game has it's own elegance. In a certain way, it is truly unique.If you're looking for a simple, rather easy-to-learn MMO with a rather different setting than most, this one might just be right for you.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												This game is far from perfect, but I couldn't care less because it's incredible. I've tried other MMOs, and none have stuck the way this one has.For one, the theme and storytelling is perfect. The characters are amazing, the fully-acted cutscenes are awesome, and the story missions are entertaining even a second time on an alt. As for the theme, it's a fantastic departure from the typical fantasy MMOs, which can be fun, but this is the only MMO I've found that has this particular feel. It's creepy, it's goofy, and it's set in modern day so it feels far more real.For two, the non-story missions don't feel like the typical MMO grind. There are a few "Kill x monsters" missions, but even those are typically wrapped in either a great narrative, an interesting location, an interesting mechanic, or all three. It doesn't feel like a grind because those "Kill x, fetch y" quests are spread out amongst other, more story-driven missions.The character models could use work, and the starter clothes are crap but there's a lot of room for clothing customization as you progress and gain money. The cash shop doesn't have pay-to-win items, and IMO they're not even edging close to that. It's like 90% hats and pants and weird animal heads. The gear that's for sale is very rapidly outclassed by other gear in-game.Speaking of gear, it's not tied to your clothes at all, so you never have to worry about choosing fashion over power. The weapons each have their own skin, but you can reskin the weapons for in-game money, or you can just disable the weapons so they only show when you're actively using them.A very rambly review, yes, but I couldn't recommend it more highly. There are some weird bugs and weird lag issues, but the story and the atmosphere make it 100% worth your time and money.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												tl;dr - Some will be turned away from the lack of convention; however, those who embrace it will be rewarded.Let me first get this out of the way: this game is not for everybody. If you want a typical, linear fantasy story; then, you are going to be very disappointed. The story of the game isn't one fluid narrative, it's the opposite. It tends to give you bits and pieces of what the storyline is as you complete quests, and you don't understand what or why you do things most of the time. Yet, that matters little in a game like this. As matter of fact, that might be the main attraction.The best part about Secret World is the apparent lack of convention. There are no classes, no levels to speak of. The level of freedom with constructing your character is quite refreshing from typical wizard/ warrior/ archer mmo's. If you make a mistake in your build or skill tree, you have the safeguard of knowing you can simply earn more SP or AP to fix your character. It's even possible to earn every skill from every weapon, and every ability from every weapon. As a matter of fact you are given a reward for doing so. The Secret World rewards players for thinking outside the box, I've never used Google to solve a quest up until I played this game. Become very comfortable with the idea that you'll be using search engines for trickier questions and riddles being asked in the game. However, there is an in-game web browser for your convenience, should you choose to use it.Yes there is grinding; but the number of content available and the variability between each quest never makes it feel like you're grinding. You can choose to rush your character to high faction ranking, or you can take your time and explore the game. The game often rewards you with achievements, lore, and some surprises if you choose to do so. This game has arguably one of the best mmo communities I've played in so far. Helpful veterans always help lower level players, and Cabals (the Secret World's version of guilds) are diverse in their members and goals, and players always seem to be working with each other to support other players who ask for help. Cabals can also hold a large number of members (I'm currently in one that has over 250 members).I bought this game on sale, and I am sad I didn't buy this sooner. However, even at full price this game is still a steal. I would definitely recommend it to those who are looking for something different and unconventional.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												Story rich, classless lvling system, great community and superbe ambiance.The game has some flaws, it suffers mostly from the different budget funded for each episodes with some clearly much better than others.That aside, the world is consistent and enjoyable, either by yourself or in group. The game designers nailed quite well the genra with the secret society and things hidden in plain sights.You will often be challenged to actually read/look for clues in your environment, there is also some puzzles that will take you time and knowlege to solve them, hence the in-game built browser.All in all, a great MMO with a good concept and even the first 4 free episodes are pentyful enough to want to get some more.The classless system is really refreshing too, you almost can't go wrong with whatever you decide to build. There are more optimum builds than others but if you follow the general guidelines you will be all fine.One thing I didn't really liked was the interraction with the secret society. You are a field agent but you hardly have any dealing with your group aside sending reports at the end of missions for rewards. Everything you need to learn is on field.I would have loved a bit more on that aspect but it is relatively minor concern of mine.

content:
Posted: February 9
												The Secret World is my first MMORPG and it really is a quality game. The horror atmosphere is great and the game has 8 large zones that are incredibly varied and range from spooky New England towns through parched desert landscapes in Egypt, vampire infested Transylvania, and finally to Tokyo after an apocalyptic infection.It has a large variety of missions, some with very interesting stories - one big stand out for me was an issue in Egypt that included a section on a train. It felt like being in an Indiana Jones movie.As a rule the community is quite supportive and there is still a stream of new players joining. The server system is such that the population in zones is controlled so it never feels crowded.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4
												The Secret World is a SUPER fun mmo, that has hardly any attention and should be better recognized. The questing system is really good and not boring at all unlike most mmo's which consist of solely fetch quests and the like, you actually feel a sense of accomplishment when completing puzzles, challenges, and missions, not to mention the cool "class" system. The game has no set classes so basically whatever kind of weapon you want to use is what you will use and then you will rank up the skills of the weapon. You can use 2 weapons at a time to make your own hybrid set up. Want to combine an AR with magic? You can do that, lots of choice and freedom. Plus its an mmo that is isn't pay to win and doesn't require a monthly sub to play. The game does have a cash shop, but you can only buy cosmetics and unique mounts and clothing in it. No P2W items available. There are also world bosses, dungeons, raids, and a good pvp system in place. All in all The Secret World is a great mmo and needs more time in the spotlight!

												The reviews present are largely for 'The Secret World.'  Funcom has relaunched the game with different mechanics.  'Secret World Legends' and 'The Secret World' are two different games.Sadly, I have been forced to provide a negative review, only because Secret World Legends has attempted to co-op The Secret World's reviews.While 'The Secret World is an amazing game with fabulous writing, 'Secret World Legends' is a separate game, and I can't in good faith give it a positive review.  Funcom produced an amazing title with 'The Secret World,' but I will not permit them to decieve potential buyers by simply switching titles.   I can't say enough good things about 'The Secret World,' but 'Secret World Legends' remains up in the air.  I would recommend waiting a time before committing to anything.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												I have a problem.No, but really..I love this game for two main reasons: there is LOADS of buy2play-content and this content is SO freaking immersive.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ Graphics 8/10 (realistic to a degree, crisp and flashy) + Sound 9/10 (veeeery eery and atmospheric) + Gameplay 11/10 (LOTS to do, lots of different mission types, PvP and PvE, dungeons, scenarios and raids - overall great and helpful community)+ Replayability 10/10 (3 char slots[extendable] with 100s of hours to play, no pressure cuz there's no mandatory subscription fee - GREAT "re-installing and getting back in the game after a while" possbilities+ Buy2Play 9/10 (I have invested about 140€ by now - only for content, and I could play 1600hrs+ with this - compared to a subscription model, this just ROCKS) EDIT: Now, that the "ultimate edition" came out the price is just riddiculously low :P - 10/10 )+ Moddable 7/10 (lots of "Curse" mods to further enhance your style of play, but lots of integrated enhancements/settings as well)+ Clothing/Achievements/Titles/Pets 10/10 (there's LOTS of different clothing to get.. everyone can look different - also you'll get rewards for ingame achievements, like titles, pets and clothing!)------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------There are downsides of course - which IMHO don't really matter. As long as you enjoy the game as it is, nothing to worry about.-----------------------------------------------------------------------  some people criticize the repetitive-ness of the missions and the need to farm/grind to get to the endgame - I myself don't think the game is too much of a grind (8 years WoW speaking here)- it is slightly underpopulated - especially when it's daytime in GMT+1- it is HIGHLY addictive - this should serve as a warning to those who get easily hooked and I mean it.There's just SO much to do, in a COOL environment set in reality. The mythical background stories are immersive as ♥♥♥♥ and you cannot help but notice that the clock somehow shows 10 hours later than when you've looked before :P-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Summary:Get this game, if you're into MMORPGs.Get this game, if you don't wanna spend too much money on a game.Get this game, if you enjoy secrets, mysteries, fantasy tales, conspiracy theories and more.Get this game for a healthy dose of humor, addiction, fantasy roleplay, slicing hoards of zombies, ocean creatures, vampires, mummies, werewolves, ghosts and dancing on the roots of Yggdrasil.Otherwise, ... well, why are you reading this review anyway ?

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Based in a modern world setting The Secret World is very unique and sets itself aside from all the other MMORPGs out there and that is a really good thing when the market is flooded by online games that are all very similar.  The Secret World is not for everybody though. While it is heavily story-driven there's a lot of puzzle solving to do and they're not always easy. One of the things I like the most about the game is the skill tree. Actually, it's not really a skill three but a skill circle, which means you can spend points in everything and make the most hybrid builds ever. Theres lots of possibilities and yes there is no particular "winning builds".If you want to discover the mysteries of our world and dig deep in the illuminati's secrets then this game is for you.

												I highly reccommend The Secret World. One of the best MMO's I've ever played. I really enjoyed the multiple styles of gameplay. The story is pretty solid. Graphics look very nice even on lower settings so if you don't have a powerful system it'll still look good. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Based in a modern world setting The Secret World is very unique and sets itself aside from all the other MMORPGs out there and that is a really good thing when the market is flooded by online games that are all very similar.  The Secret World is not for everybody though. While it is heavily story-driven there's a lot of puzzle solving to do and they're not always easy. One of the things I like the most about the game is the skill tree. Actually, it's not really a skill three but a skill circle, which means you can spend points in everything and make the most hybrid builds ever. Theres lots of possibilities and yes there is no particular "winning builds".If you want to discover the mysteries of our world and dig deep in the illuminati's secrets then this game is for you.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Easy recommendation. I really enjoyed this game, it is very unique for a MMO and the story was well done - Lots of content to keep you playing. However, the endgame game play isn't easy to break into, groups are unnecessarily elitist, leaving long queue times, and ultimately the reason I rarely play now. For the price,  0 - end game was well worth it.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												Ill be honest, Im no fan of mmo's. But this one did catch my eye, content wise. It has more than any mmo Ive seen so far and thats worth. But for $30... it is not. I bought this game in high hopes paying for such amount was going to be worth. In my opinion it is not, for several reasons. Im not too great at reviewing, but I will say I am gonna try to get a refund.I reccomend this for the people with either no lives or love all MMOs. Youll love it then. Cons-1. Slow gameplay.2. Some levels of p2w but not much.3. lies about being a non-typical MMO4. there is classes, its the weapon types. Another lie.5. Boring solo, and you basically need a friend or 3 at times otherwise youll get lost in a puzzle or will have to grind for a whole 2 days to kill a enemy.6. $30 DOLLARS ? NAH. Id rate it a 20 max.  Theres more but I dont wanna bash a game too hard. And oh i can with this. But lets get on the good parts. Pros:1. Fantastic artwork in my opinion.2. skill tree is alright, better than most.3. The community is good, some will help you level, do quests, and go through dungeons. Mostle helpful. (Some will be trolling aswell.)4. Lots of content, like quite  a damn bit. They sure put work in that. 5. Easy and customizeable design of Hud and easy to use systems.6. If on sale for anything less than 30 dollars. GET IT. comes with free month membership which is how long youll play it.7. Some pretty hard quests and some that are new for any MMO. Like puzzles that you literally have to google details, become a detective, and wander far to figure out.Overall 6/10 for me not liking most MMOs, and a easy 8.5/10 for people who like them.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												The Secret World or TSW is an excellent MMO produced by Funcom.For starters you can pick up most of the DLC and maingame for just $60 as part of the Ultimate Edition which is about as much as you would have payed for a AAA game without the DLC.Here is a good tip to those who do not know about the "leveling" process. Your character can learn every ability and skill in the game and can assign only up to 7 abilities on to two bars, one for actives the other for passive effects. You may be wondering what classes in the game there are, truth is their are none. You are only limited to the combination of weapons such as Pistol and Shotgun or Blood and Sword when it comes to how you play your character. So you might have messed up your build, don't worry, you can repeat any mission except the main storyline missions. As these will provide you with the necessary experience to gain ability points and skill points.Although the setting is modern day and it presents itself in a grim dark fantasy, the story and npcs are very meaningful and quiet human for how they deal with their situations.The most populated shard, according to my research, is Cereberus. I mention this as you may notice that the lower level zones are quiet empty so bringing a friend in is a welcome idea. Although when it comes to raiding and dungeons, don't fret as you can join parties across shards.The game is definetly my recommendation as its very well made for an MMO in today's market.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												TLDR:  Go buy this game right now.I came way late to the party to The Secret World, and I'm sorry I did.   This is not only one of the best MMOs ever made, it's one of the best games ever made.  The quality of the quests alone is enough to warrent a purchase, especially now that it's F2P.  In no particular order, why you should buy this game immediately.1.  Character building.  If you like tinkering with characters, this game is like crack.  You can choose any combination of skills and passives at any time, save the build, and switch between them pretty much instantly.  This is a character tinkerers dream.  Once again, worth buying the game *just* for this.2.  The quests.  I'm not usually much one for quests, and I tend to find them boring, poorly thought out and/or written, or really flimsly excuses to get you to go pick up 10 bear asses.  This is the first MMO I've played where I look forward to the next quest string.  The writing is superb, not just for a video game, but in any context.  The voice work is also outstanding.  The game is intelligent, and funny, a great combination.3.  The world.  The game world is really fantastic, and draws you in to the setting very well.  It's easy to suspend disbelief and really buy in to the world.4.  The QUESTSSSSSSSS.  They are so good, and so varied.  There are so many different kinds of quests....it's...amazing really.  There are more good quests in this game than all other MMOs combined in the history of MMOs, and that's not hyperbole, I've played most of them.5.  The challenge.  Both from a combat perspective, and a using your nogging perspective.  You actually have to think in this game to solve some things.  You also have to pay attention to what you're doing and how you're buidling your character.  Random run of the mill quest mobs can and will kill you if you don't pay attention.  I love that.  It's not so hard that it's frustrating, but it's hard enough that it keeps you engaged, unlike every other MMO that more or less lulls you to sleep while leveling.  Leveling in this game is *FUN*....gasp.This game is an absolute steal at 10 times the price, once again, not hyperbole.  Why this hasn't gotten more attention, I'll never know.  Maybe it's too smart for people?  I dont' get it....  This game is amazing, and by far my favorite MMO for ages, and close to being my favorite of all time.This game is in my top 10 games of all time right now, not just MMOs, but anything.  I'm shocked at how good this is, and how little attention it's gotten.  Everyone that is even remotely interested in character progression games should own this.

												First off 350 hrs spent and still not done!!! Love this game with the different aspects that it brings to traditional MMO's. There are so many different classes and skills sets that you can really change how you play the gmae to how you look. It's a small company that runs the game and a good group that still maintains the community. Which is friendly compared to others out there (DOTA-sneer) Have no shortage of content if you buy the memership for life which is steep but the content and story makes up for it. There is again no shortage of content or skill building inthis game. Is there a end game? Yes and brings more to the table. The lore and backstory to this game is one that everyone should read and playthrough at lest once. Again 350hrs and still playing. Just check it out before deciding to go full membership. (no subscriptions for full membership and FREE stuff to boot)

content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												Secret World is a very interesting MMO currently on the Market, for a unique still of game like this i would rather have a list of Pros and Cons for it;ProsAmazing QuestsThis game has some of the best MMO quest's i've came across they make you actually think and solve problems. You will need a Bible, know Binary, know Borse code and much more just to complete these quests.Interesting Story/ArtCurrently i can't find a good mmo with a story similar to Secret World it has a very interesting approuch to Mythology. Overall i enjoy the feel of the game.ConsBoring Animations/EffectsCurrently in the games current form the animations/effects are very basic along with the Combat System while i enjoy the idea of the game most of the animations are simple spins with colorful effects tied to them. Nothing to be impressed by and very dull to look at all day not to mention it doesn't give you that feeling of being a Powerful being when you are a ballerina 24/7Confusing QuestsI'm not asking the quests to baby-mode me and i do enjoy the overall idea of the quests however, while they are Amazing they are still confusing... If anyone spends too much time on on quest they will most likely lose intrest and just quit the game. The quests are a double sided sword.PvPPvP on this game is very boring in my eyes... The damage output on the game needs to be overlooked with a few other things to make this game be very successful. However, this could just be a personal opinion when i'm trying to be biased as possible.Try out the game yourself, Its truly something you should experience yourself (As i think almost every game is) Overall the Cons i listed are a few of the things i dislike about the game but you might not see as a Big deal or even enjoy

												Combat:Bash buttons repeatedly to rake up combo points that soon gets repetitive Grindy identical looking zombiesQuests that give no clue what you are meant to look for or doSabotage Quest - you jump over infrared lines you can barely see, or you explode. Then you hide from Security cameras, or you explode. Keep exploding every 90 seconds until you get the sequence right.Constructing / Deconstructing items, the "help" is a picture of tiny identical boxes in item patterns. What does that mean?Bugs. A Ladder bug. How old is this game?The story seems interesting; You may as well watch cutscenes on Youtube. The developer seems to have looked at being innovative and overlooked doing fundamental things well.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
												One of the best... if not the best mmorpg i have ever played. Definitely a game to try!!!EDIT: ... Still the best mmorpg I have ever played, its got tactical and strategy situations, character development is very vast and there are at least 300+ different builds for tanking, dps, support, medic, etc, also it is updated quite often and there are new players joining all the time.BUT.... best of all it never ever EVER gets boring!!! there are way too many  things to do o theres never a dull moment, which compels you to keep playing... which in my opinion bumps it to 1st place.=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=SPOILERS=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=I dont know why I marked this section as spoilers... even if I keep talking for an hour I still wouldnt even scratch the surace of this games amazing storyline.So... you start with one of 3 factions in this game, Dragon, Illuminati and Templar. The faction you are in only makes a difference when it comes to boosts and buffs which changes dependiing on how your faction does in PvP. You also choose 2 wapons from a selection of 9 different kinds of weapons (3 Melee, 3 Ranged and 3 Magic), although you are limited to 2 weapons at a time there is no rectriction on how many weapons you choose to master ... meaning that there is a huge lot of customizing available and choosing the right 2 weapon combo is all up to you ...(I suggest Assault Rifle and dual pistols for beginners :D). Each weapon has active abilities and Passive abilities which you can chose from but you can only have 7 active and 7 passive abilities equiped at once, but there are over 40+ different actives and passives for each weapon which makes character development very very interesting. You can also import and export your builds or other builds from different players and this is an in game feature not a mod. So players can share thier builds with each other. PvE builds and PvP builds can be the same but usually they differ a lot. I usually tank in PvP and my builds for PvE are vastly diferent, they might have the same weapons but totally different actives and passives. You can find a lot of good builds for PvE online but PvP builds are not so easy to find, players who do well in PvP want to keep it that way so hardly anyone shares good PvP builds but I guess thats expected. What makes this weapons customizing even more awesome is that you are not limited to the passive abilities of the weapons you have equipped, for ex: If I have chaos magic and elemental magic equipped (good weapons for intermediate players) I can equip a passive ability of assualt rifles which increases accuracy even when no assualt rifles are equipped. SO ... I guess you kinda see why i said it never gets boring... but this isnt even the tip of the iceberg lol. After weapon abilities comes armor/armour. The armor aka talismans you can equip come in levels, so level 1 talimans <lvl2 talismans<lvl3 and so on. But its not so simple as that, there are different lvl 1 talismans with varying stats. To equip higher lvl talismans you have to master the lvl in your skills table first. Same is for equipping higher lvl weapons. There isnt a character lvl system, but rather a stat based system. And your stats get affected by weapons and talismans. The higher the lvl, the better the stats. Doing missions grants you 2 different kinds of points, AP which is ability points and SP which are skill points.  To unlock wepon active&passive abilities you need AP. To increase the lvl of weapons or talismans you can equip you need SP. Generally AP is gained faster than SP but that kind of balances out as you progress in the storyline. I suggest that when using SP, focus on talismans first then weapons and there are 2 different streams for weapons, max out one stream first then move on to the next because if you spend SP equally on the streams, you might have both streams at lvl 5 lets say, you will only be able to equip lvl 5 weapons even though the total amount of SP spent, if spent on one stream only, would allow you to equip a lvl 7 or lvl 8 weapon. But in the end its up to the players as to how to spend thier AP and SP :D. Lastly, for weapon customizing, you can greatly impact your stats by glyphs. Glyphs are an accessory for weapons and talismans. There are tons of different glyphys that each have different stats that can be applied to the weapon or to you (talismans). Sooooo.... that was JUST weapons and that was a brief explanation :P. Theres quite a lot more to weapons, talismans and glyphs but this should be enough to get you started. Moving on to other things I love about this game... Crafting. Not a lot off players like crafting in the beginning of the game but thats only because its not easy getting materials early on. But you can craft any weapon, talisman or glyph as long as you have the materials. But crafting is a little different in The Secret World. You dont just click craft and voila the equipment is crafted, thats boring. Luckily we have a way more interesting crafting process which you will learn very early on in the game so im not gonna type up another essay to explain that, just know... they found a way to make crafting fun :D.PvP: PvP is again a lot of fun. There are 3 different battlefields you can fight on and each has completely different set of rules and objectives. So its not just 1v1 or team battles. The following site can explain PvP briefly or in detail a lot better than I ever could so make sure to check it out, https://forums.thesecretworld.com/showthread.php?60445-PvP-101-The-Beginner-s-Guide-to-TSW-s-PvP.Theres so much more I can talk about, relating to this game but it would all be but words you are reading, If you really want to know what the game is like you should play it :D. The cost is so meager compared to content of the game and its just a one time fee. Also theres no kind of pay to win scheme. The only thing ive ever bought from the store is boosts. Other than boosts theres not much that money can buy to give you an edge over others which is the biggest selling factor in my opinion. I wont deny that there are other mmorpgs with similar characteristics but I am positive that The Secret World is one of the very few (I can count them on both hands) that combine all these amazing features into one very very very amazing game :) If anyone needs any help dont hesitate to send me a message here on steam on in game (IGN: NexisX)
