The faction you are in only makes a difference when it comes to boosts and buffs which changes dependiing on how your faction does in PvP. You also choose 2 wapons from a selection of 9 different kinds of weapons (3 Melee, 3 Ranged and 3 Magic), although you are limited to 2 weapons at a time there is no rectriction on how many weapons you choose to master ... meaning that there is a huge lot of customizing available and choosing the right 2 weapon combo is all up to you ...(I suggest Assault Rifle and dual pistols for beginners :D). Each weapon has active abilities and Passive abilities which you can chose from but you can only have 7 active and 7 passive abilities equiped at once, but there are over 40+ different actives and passives for each weapon which makes character development very very interesting. You can also import and export your builds or other builds from different players and this is an in game feature not a mod. So players can share thier builds with each other. PvE builds and PvP builds can be the same but usually they differ a lot. I usually tank in PvP and my builds for PvE are vastly diferent, they might have the same weapons but totally different actives and passives. You can find a lot of good builds for PvE online but PvP builds are not so easy to find, players who do well in PvP want to keep it that way so hardly anyone shares good PvP builds but I guess thats expected. What makes this weapons customizing even more awesome is that you are not limited to the passive abilities of the weapons you have equipped, for ex: If I have chaos magic and elemental magic equipped (good weapons for intermediate players) I can equip a passive ability of assualt rifles which increases accuracy even when no assualt rifles are equipped. SO ... I guess you kinda see why i said it never gets boring... but this isnt even the tip of the iceberg lol. After weapon abilities comes armor/armour. The armor aka talismans you can equip come in levels, so level 1 talimans <lvl2 talismans<lvl3 and so on. But its not so simple as that, there are different lvl 1 talismans with varying stats. To equip higher lvl talismans you have to master the lvl in your skills table first. Same is for equipping higher lvl weapons. There isnt a character lvl system, but rather a stat based system. And your stats get affected by weapons and talismans. The higher the lvl, the better the stats. Doing missions grants you 2 different kinds of points, AP which is ability points and SP which are skill points.  To unlock wepon active&passive abilities you need AP. To increase the lvl of weapons or talismans you can equip you need SP. Generally AP is gained faster than SP but that kind of balances out as you progress in the storyline. I suggest that when using SP, focus on talismans first then weapons and there are 2 different streams for weapons, max out one stream first then move on to the next because if you spend SP equally on the streams, you might have both streams at lvl 5 lets say, you will only be able to equip lvl 5 weapons even though the total amount of SP spent, if spent on one stream only, would allow you to equip a lvl 7 or lvl 8 weapon. But in the end its up to the players as to how to spend thier AP and SP :D. Lastly, for weapon customizing, you can greatly impact your stats by glyphs. Glyphs are an accessory for weapons and talismans. There are tons of different glyphys that each have different stats that can be applied to the weapon or to you (talismans). Sooooo.... that was JUST weapons and that was a brief explanation :P. Theres quite a lot more to weapons, talismans and glyphs but this should be enough to get you started. Moving on to other things I love about this game... Crafting. Not a lot off players like crafting in the beginning of the game but thats only because its not easy getting materials early on. But you can craft any weapon, talisman or glyph as long as you have the materials. But crafting is a little different in The Secret World. You dont just click craft and voila the equipment is crafted, thats boring. Luckily we have a way more interesting crafting process which you will learn very early on in the game so im not gonna type up another essay to explain that, just know... they found a way to make crafting fun :D.PvP: PvP is again a lot of fun. There are 3 different battlefields you can fight on and each has completely different set of rules and objectives. So its not just 1v1 or team battles. The following site can explain PvP briefly or in detail a lot better than I ever could so make sure to check it out, https://forums.thesecretworld.com/showthread.php?60445-PvP-101-The-Beginner-s-Guide-to-TSW-s-PvP.Theres so much more I can talk about, relating to this game but it would all be but words you are reading, If you really want to know what the game is like you should play it :D. The cost is so meager compared to content of the game and its just a one time fee. Also theres no kind of pay to win scheme. The only thing ive ever bought from the store is boosts. Other than boosts theres not much that money can buy to give you an edge over others which is the biggest selling factor in my opinion. I wont deny that there are other mmorpgs with similar characteristics but I am positive that The Secret World is one of the very few (I can count them on both hands) that combine all these amazing features into one very very very amazing game :) If anyone needs any help dont hesitate to send me a message here on steam on in game (IGN: NexisX)

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												Вам надоели типичные ВоВ и Линейка?Хотите увидить что-то интерестное и новое в mmorpg?Тогда Вам в The secret world.Действие разворачивается в современном мире,это один из самых важных моментов.Представьте, что каждый миф, каждая теория заговора и каждая городская легенда – правда. Вообразите реальность, в которой вампиры охотятся на живых людей в модных лондонских клубах, где в канализации под Сеулом рыскают оборотни, а в темных закоулках Нью-Йорка обитает нежить. Таков мир многопользовательской ролевой онлайновой игры The Secret World, разрабатываемой компанией Funcom.Вообразите мир где вы можете стать тем, кем вы мечтаете, мир где нет таких ограничений как классы персонажей и уровни.Представьте себе мир, где правительства стран незримо управляются кардиналами из секретных сообществ. В игре The Secret World вы сможете приобщиться к их тайнам. Иллюминати, Драконы и Темплары – каждое общество отстаивает свои интересы и ведет войну с надвигающейся тьмой. В зависимости от того к какому секретному сообществу вы решите присоединиться, ваш игровой персонаж и все ваши впечатления и события в игре будут полностью изменены.ОСОБЕННОСТИ !  ○Ни классов, ни уровней – только полная свобода. В The Secret World нет ни классов, ни уровней. Вы можете стать кем угодно и играть так, как вам хочется.  ○Узнаваемые страны. Действие The Secret World разворачивается в современном мире. Исследуйте города и участвуйте в приключениях на различных континентах!  ○Вступайте в тайное общество и сражайтесь под его флагами. Пополните ряды ордена Иллюминатов (Illuminati),              Драконов (Dragon) или Храмовников (Templars), чтобы сражаться против других игроков (или плечом к плечу с ними) за власть над миром.  ○Потрясающий сюжет, какого еще не было у MMO. Над игрой работает гениальный Рагнар Торнквист (Ragnar Tørnquist) – автор The Longest Journey.  ○Тысячи единиц оружия и множество специальных возможностей. Пистолеты, штурмовые винтовки, черная магия, катаны, взрывчатка – вас ждет множество видов оружия и особых приемов.P.S:Игра стоит своих денег.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												It's an MMO. If you don't like MMOs, just pass on this. The characters are surprisingly good for an MMO, but that agonizingly slow slog through the "gameplay" keeps the player from actually getting to see anything fun or interesting. It's standard MMO fare. The settings are different, but all these damed MMOs seem to be the same. Piles of players run around, killing crap while you kill your own crap, you get a quest that sounds interested but amounts to killing X # of zombies and getting X # of items from their corpses, wash, rinse, repeat. I was a fool for buying this and thinking it would be any different from other MMOs aside from the setting. Save yourself time and money. There are so many better games out there. This is not even the least bit enjoyable. I wouldn't even recommend it if it were free to play unless you already love MMOs in general.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												I loved parts of TSW.  The lore is great, and the quests are some of the most interesting that I've ever played.  Some of them were genuinely moving, or laugh-out-loud funny.  The investigation quests are unlike anything that I've ever played before.  All of these things basically made for a fabulous single-player game.  I played that game, and loved it.  I'll probably pick up the various expansion packs as they're released, and play the new content.  The mmo parts... are not so good.  The Dungeons are "meh" and the pvp combat is dull and grindy.  I could never bring myself to play the raid content, because I'm allergic to grinding.  The single-player aspects of the game are good enough, however, that it's absolutely worth buying and playing.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
												One of the best... if not the best mmorpg i have ever played. Definitely a game to try!!!EDIT: ... Still the best mmorpg I have ever played, its got tactical and strategy situations, character development is very vast and there are at least 300+ different builds for tanking, dps, support, medic, etc, also it is updated quite often and there are new players joining all the time.BUT.... best of all it never ever EVER gets boring!!! there are way too many  things to do o theres never a dull moment, which compels you to keep playing... which in my opinion bumps it to 1st place.=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=SPOILERS=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=I dont know why I marked this section as spoilers... even if I keep talking for an hour I still wouldnt even scratch the surace of this games amazing storyline.So... you start with one of 3 factions in this game, Dragon, Illuminati and Templar. The faction you are in only makes a difference when it comes to boosts and buffs which changes dependiing on how your faction does in PvP. You also choose 2 wapons from a selection of 9 different kinds of weapons (3 Melee, 3 Ranged and 3 Magic), although you are limited to 2 weapons at a time there is no rectriction on how many weapons you choose to master ... meaning that there is a huge lot of customizing available and choosing the right 2 weapon combo is all up to you ...(I suggest Assault Rifle and dual pistols for beginners :D). Each weapon has active abilities and Passive abilities which you can chose from but you can only have 7 active and 7 passive abilities equiped at once, but there are over 40+ different actives and passives for each weapon which makes character development very very interesting. You can also import and export your builds or other builds from different players and this is an in game feature not a mod. So players can share thier builds with each other. PvE builds and PvP builds can be the same but usually they differ a lot. I usually tank in PvP and my builds for PvE are vastly diferent, they might have the same weapons but totally different actives and passives. You can find a lot of good builds for PvE online but PvP builds are not so easy to find, players who do well in PvP want to keep it that way so hardly anyone shares good PvP builds but I guess thats expected. What makes this weapons customizing even more awesome is that you are not limited to the passive abilities of the weapons you have equipped, for ex: If I have chaos magic and elemental magic equipped (good weapons for intermediate players) I can equip a passive ability of assualt rifles which increases accuracy even when no assualt rifles are equipped. SO ... I guess you kinda see why i said it never gets boring... but this isnt even the tip of the iceberg lol. After weapon abilities comes armor/armour. The armor aka talismans you can equip come in levels, so level 1 talimans <lvl2 talismans<lvl3 and so on. But its not so simple as that, there are different lvl 1 talismans with varying stats. To equip higher lvl talismans you have to master the lvl in your skills table first. Same is for equipping higher lvl weapons. There isnt a character lvl system, but rather a stat based system. And your stats get affected by weapons and talismans. The higher the lvl, the better the stats. Doing missions grants you 2 different kinds of points, AP which is ability points and SP which are skill points.  To unlock wepon active&passive abilities you need AP. To increase the lvl of weapons or talismans you can equip you need SP. Generally AP is gained faster than SP but that kind of balances out as you progress in the storyline. I suggest that when using SP, focus on talismans first then weapons and there are 2 different streams for weapons, max out one stream first then move on to the next because if you spend SP equally on the streams, you might have both streams at lvl 5 lets say, you will only be able to equip lvl 5 weapons even though the total amount of SP spent, if spent on one stream only, would allow you to equip a lvl 7 or lvl 8 weapon. But in the end its up to the players as to how to spend thier AP and SP :D. Lastly, for weapon customizing, you can greatly impact your stats by glyphs. Glyphs are an accessory for weapons and talismans. There are tons of different glyphys that each have different stats that can be applied to the weapon or to you (talismans). Sooooo.... that was JUST weapons and that was a brief explanation :P. Theres quite a lot more to weapons, talismans and glyphs but this should be enough to get you started. Moving on to other things I love about this game... Crafting. Not a lot off players like crafting in the beginning of the game but thats only because its not easy getting materials early on. But you can craft any weapon, talisman or glyph as long as you have the materials. But crafting is a little different in The Secret World. You dont just click craft and voila the equipment is crafted, thats boring. Luckily we have a way more interesting crafting process which you will learn very early on in the game so im not gonna type up another essay to explain that, just know... they found a way to make crafting fun :D.PvP: PvP is again a lot of fun. There are 3 different battlefields you can fight on and each has completely different set of rules and objectives. So its not just 1v1 or team battles. The following site can explain PvP briefly or in detail a lot better than I ever could so make sure to check it out, https://forums.thesecretworld.com/showthread.php?60445-PvP-101-The-Beginner-s-Guide-to-TSW-s-PvP.Theres so much more I can talk about, relating to this game but it would all be but words you are reading, If you really want to know what the game is like you should play it :D. The cost is so meager compared to content of the game and its just a one time fee. Also theres no kind of pay to win scheme. The only thing ive ever bought from the store is boosts. Other than boosts theres not much that money can buy to give you an edge over others which is the biggest selling factor in my opinion. I wont deny that there are other mmorpgs with similar characteristics but I am positive that The Secret World is one of the very few (I can count them on both hands) that combine all these amazing features into one very very very amazing game :) If anyone needs any help dont hesitate to send me a message here on steam on in game (IGN: NexisX)

												Far and away the best MMO.An xp system that rewards creativity and doesn't punish mistakes. content:
Posted: April 21, 2016
												The weakest part of this game is the button pushy, clunky combat. I wish they'd taken a page (or the whole damn book) from Age of Conan when coming up with TSW's combat. Oh well, I live with it 'cause I love everything else about this game (and really, with the right key  mapping you can make the combat tolerable, if not particularly fun). Awesome story, modern times, conspiracy theories, occult themes and symbols, Lovecraftian horror, an outfit you can love and not have to change because it's gear specs, ability points (AP) and skill points (SP) that matter. I got this game shortly after launch but it did not play well on my old PC. With my new PC it's a thing of beauty...the Ultimate Edition comes with some nifty goodies. Get it! It's a great deal!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 18, 2014
												Definitely one of the best MMOs out thereSure it's different, yes it's hard and it certainly makes you use your brain a lot. And why would that ever be bad?The story is absolutely captivating, the details put into every aspect of it are bound to catch any fan of horror/sci-fi and it is lovely, as a long-time fan of Ragnar Tornquist's work, to see tiny elements of The Longest Journey in there.It brings something new to the MMO genre and while it's certainly not for everyone, its uniqueness and niche content are certain to draw only the truly interested. It's never going to be BIG, but it's never going to suffer the social downsides of more generic MMOs like Guild Wars, Rift or WoW. TSW is a mature game catered to a specific niche audience, and it's great at what it does.As a downside, combat can and often is either repetitive or frustrating. Builds require a lot of tinkering and calibration to be made viable, but in the world of Google this can be easily by-passed by looking up various builds perfected by the community and just using those. Therein comes the second problem: repetition. Rotation-based combat works, but people are getting bored of it and many modern MMOs are doing their best to steer away from it. Not TSW sadly, and I often find myself pressing 12311111241111... ad infinitum until something is dead. Thankfully, the necessity for dodging out of the way of many attacks keeps me on my toes, and is one of the things keeping combat from being unbearably dull. But hey! Repetitve combat gives me the chance to spend my time admiring the awesome monster models, which are beautifully designed, crafted and animated.In all, fantastic game with some mechanical drawbacks, but as long as you don't mind mashing buttons, you're going to enjoy the hell out of it (literally, perhaps).

Posted: June 15, 2015
												After playing this for much longer, I am going to revise my review. If you want something thats just modern and kinda different in the MMO world, give it a chance. But only buy it if its cheap and on sale.  1.The story seems unimportant and the characters dont warrant enough energy to care about them or their stories. 2.The voice acting is okay and the graphics were nice but the game seems like it is lacking purpose. (I stopped playing it for a bit and tried again and I dont even remember why my character is out running around killing zombies.)  3.It is more like a single player run around and kill stuff type of game rather than an MMO. 4.The controls are clunky unless you can bind a script to handle a mouse free look camera control (i had to in order to play it)  5.The interface is weird and not easy to master.I will give it the thumbs up but only because it brought something new and interesting to my computer.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
												This game is about the story. Such an awesome story. And puzzles, oh my. This game requires you to research everything from Hebrew alphabet to Egyptian mythology, translate Romanian, research pharmaceuticals...and so much more. Very dark horror themes. Play this long enough you WILL dream about it. And you will catch yourself humming the music. Especially a certain Lullaby. This is a damned smart game, and I love it.Mechanics - the combat doesn't suck. There are way better combat mechanics out there, and if that is a primary issue for you then you probably want to keep walking. The deck system is nicely complex and lets the biggest control freak and stats fan have hours of fun putting together builds. But when you hit Issue #8 in Venice they added a new mechanic that is really grind heavy and then becomes essentially useless when you hit Tokyo. I suspect player retention would improve if they stripped that out completely. The scenarios are a fun mechanic and nice for grinding for purple gear but don't spend a lot of time on the augment business - just get to Tokyo where the most recent mechanic kicks in. Game stability has been really good for me, plenty of tutorials and info out there from the player community and you WILL need those. So if you love a great story and some compelling content this is your game.

content:
Posted: March 19
												Best storytelling and worldbuilding I've seen in an MMO, and I've played alot of MMOs.  Where most settle for excuse plots or contrived backstory for the PvP backbone developers hope will keep people interested once they've reached max level, The Secret World has a continuing story that's both brilliantly written and exquisitely voiced.  Even the intros to what would otherwise feel like 'filler' quests are made interesting by great writing and every one is fully voice acted.On the contrary, combat options are strictly limited during the fray, but needlessly complex during setup.  The most difficult achievements in the hardest dungeons are those which require all players to refrain from changing skill setups between bosses.  TSW is a great game for story, and absolutely worth playing for that reason, even if you're a single player without a group to run with.  Finding answers to the deeper mysteries will require the aid of 4 helpful folks, but helpful folks are easy to find in TSW's many custom channels.  I wouldn't recommend this as someone's first MMO, but I'd absolutely recommend it as a second, just to show players new to the genre what a difference a great story can make.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 11
Product received for free
												Overall: 8/10This game is a lot of fun to play, and that's what's most important. It's a lot less focused on character class (In fact, there are no classes) and more focused on your particular play style. You can find what works for you, character customization is top-notch in terms of outfit options, and the game's story is deeply interesting.My personal favorite part of the game is the 'Investigation missions'. These missions require you to use your brain and think logically -- a skill sorely missed in other mmo's. Also these missions often require you to think outside the box and even outside the game-- they're very immersive. Combat took me a little getting used to but once you figure out how it works it runs fairly smoothly. Voice acting in the game ranges from decent to sub-par, nothing exceptional but nothing that has me scrambling to mute it either. The overall story is excellent but character dialogue could use a little improvement in its writing; for example, there are many quests where you'll approach an npc, they'll give you their life story without so much as a hello first, and then you're scratching your head as to why you now have a quest to kill 15 zombies.I don't know whether this is a pro or a con, it's up to you: This game does not hold your hand at all. In fact, it throws you into the deep end without even a 'good luck'. You're given a very basic tutorial and then pretty much sent on your way. You have to figure a lot out on your own and if you're like me you'll spend a lot of time on google during the first few hours of the game. There is a web browser built into the game but it's often easier to just minimize the game--the browser is slower than average, and it can't be minimized, only closed (though you can move it off-screen).I can't take any points off for this, but it is a con: Unless you know people who play the game it's a fairly lonely experience. I rarely see other players except in the capital cities and they're very very quiet. This is a great game and I think it deserves a lot more players than it has. Please give this game a try, it's totally worth it! And at $30 it's a steal! (I received it as a gift several years ago)Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 1, 2016
												Now that I've put some time into this game (The Secret World, not Secret World Legends) I think I can leave a better review.Pros:1) Amazing storytelling. It's detailed, creative, and always leaves you craving more.2) The investigation missions. These babies are hooked me into the game. They are challenging, require all sorts of random knowledge/skills, and they leave you feeling extremely satisfied if you solved them without refering to a guide for answers. 3) The environment. Personally I am playing this game on a POS computer, but even on low settings this game is beautiful and creates an atmosphere that draws you into the horrors of the events surrounding you.4) The skill wheel. While it was confusing at first, the freedom you have from being able to create and adapt your deck to your playstyle is a breath of fresh air from other MMO's where you need to take x skill over y skill or you're bad. 5) The community. The people in this game are kind, funny, and helpful. It is always a pleasure checking into #Sanctuary to see what those wonderful ladies and gents are up to.6) The lore. The lore in this game is detailed and feeds into your understanding of the world if you take the time to read it. It is also amazing when someone in your group finds a piece since it tends to lead to a loud "LORE" in the voice channel, followed by everyone else scrambling to make their way over to the lore.Cons:1) Jumping. This jumping mechanic in this game (at least from my experience) is not always accurate or consistant making certain missions that involve a bit of platforming more frustrating than they need to be. 2) Solo instances. While these are fine overall, it was frustrating encountering them early on while playing with a friend. We were building our decks around the working together which meant when we were not grouped that things became way more difficult and we would have to grind out some extra AP to fix one of our decks while the other person waited to progress further. So overall this is an amazing game and I hope that Funcom does it justice with their relaunch of Secret World Legends.10 out of 10. Would (will) eat the bees again.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Set in the present day, players roll up the appearance of their avatars and pick one of three secret societies (Illuminati, Templars, Ancients).  A couple of short cutscenes introduce you to your new bosses and leads you into the tutorial section of the game.  From there, you're off on a journey to build your powers and your reputation within your organization that will take you from the nicest little island in New England ever go to Hell, to the sands of Egypt and a crazed cult ready to burn up the world, to the dark forests of Transylvania for a showdown with creatures of the night that put Bela Lugosi and Lon Chaney, Jr. to shame.  But if you need to take a break from saving the world, you can always duck into El Dorado or Stonehenge to challenge other agents and take control of the mystical sites which help your particular society when you decide to go back out into the field.There are no classes in the game.  Your role is determined by your gear and your equipped skills, both active and passive.  Weapons are the base from which you build off of.  Thus, it's possible for two players to be using the same weapon family, but have considerably different roles when going through group missions.Funcom has done an excellent job creating a world that is both relatable and mysterious for players to explore. The Secret World delivers an MMO experience that's distinctly different from its competitors!

content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												If you're looking for a MMORPG with a good storyline and great environment this is a great game. Repeatable quests, immersive storylines, and rich environments really bring a lot to the table. As well as hours of customization in your character's playstyle and look. If you're looking for a MMORPG with good PVP, go play something else. The PVP in this game is so insanely unbalanced and even more unfriendly to new players. As a new player you will have to grind PVP through endless hours of getting one shotted to be able to get PVP suits to use only in PVP zones just to be able to contribute to your team in some way. Before that point you're really just filling up a slot on the team that a geared player could have taken and provided help in some way.This game could really use some form of balancing or some way for new players to get the gear that would make them capable of lasting more than 2 seconds against the players who are fully geared.

number of helpful: 11 of 24 people (46%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
												One could argue that this game has a good storyline, but to me, the gameplay mechanics of a game are much more important than it's story, which is why I do not recommend this game.This must be one of the blandest MMOs I have played. The combat is simply horrible.The weapons (I am an FPS player so I have experience with good implementation of firearms) have no impact. They don't feel like anything, its all hotbar based, no aiming, no skill, just button mashing till oblivion.They sound bad, they look bad.Animation is really not one of this game's strong points either. They look very clunky and not at all fluid as they should.Graphics wise, the game is okay. This is one of the criteria I generally don't spend too much time judging, it's all right. It could be leagues better, but it's definitely passable.Customisation is one of the worst I have ever seen in an MMO. Customisation in an RPG is important. Customisation in an MMO is ESSENTIAL. Character customisation is what makes you unique. If you can only choose between 5 preset faces and 6 hairstyles, then there's no point.The only metric in which this game exceeds expectations is the voice acting, which is honestly baffling. Everything else feels so mediocre and then you hear movie quality voice acting coming out of people's mouths. Real shame that the animations during cutscenes (mostly) suck and that you're just another silent protagonist with no choices.As mentionned, combat is just plain.So much so that I can't in good conscience recommend this game.If you want a good MMO with some actual decent gameplay, look towards GW2, or TESO.I usually don't get sick of games this fast, but this just feels like a cheap browser game that you play for free for 20 minutes until you realise it is just another WoW clone.If only the combat held up, I would've probably been drawn into the story and lore, but there is a limit to what I am willing to subject myself to, and all this game did was bore me.I could recommend this if you really REALLY didn't care what you play as long as you have a good story, but even then, better games will do this for you ie: the telltale series.A disappointment, probably unjustified given the release date of the game and me treating it as if it was released in 2016. But now is when I bought it, and I regret purchasing it, even for the low price of 10 pounds for the ultimate edition.To me, this game feels like it should be free to play because of it's massive lack of certain essential aspects. I think it's too late to hope that the game will change for the better, because it's already been very long since release and it's base concepts are flawed.4.5/10 - a below average game that failed to captivate me even though I felt that the lore was well set up, because of bad design decisions concerning major gameplay elements.PS: I should probably also mention other small things about this:- The initial loading time is ridiculous. (like upwards of one minute from executable launch to game launching -albeit, without an SSD-), and you can add to that 30 seconds of logos before you get to the main menu, which won't remember your password, forcing me to alt tab out to get the password from my third party password storage software - it's a pain. EVERY game should have an auto login function (Warframe I'm looking at you!).- Servers aren't location based (which is afaik stupid af) So I was matched with a Canadian when I was playing, which in itself isnt much of an issue, because whatever lag there is, the combat is so approximate that it doesn't change much. in PvP though? I assume there will be some consequences.- The text is really small, which is frustrating when you're trying to read up pages and pages of lore. I'm half blind. I've looked through the options and for now I haven't found a way to increase the font size. Maybe I'm looking in the wrong place. Maybe the settings menu is badly designed... who knows?-The UI sucks so bad. and I think I know why. It's because it's positionning was badly coded. I think the issue is that it was hard coded and linked to a low resolution, and therefore, because im playing in 1080p, things that should be on the bottom of the screen are now in the middle. This is the first time this ever happens to me in a game.

content:
Posted: March 29
												I would hope that people are intelligent enough and research enough to know not to let personal prejudice or assumptions over business models influence their reviewing a game not even out yet. Even fans of TSW like myself, that have stuck with the game do point out it has many shortcomings and have voiced a desire for the game to update or fix these. It costs nothing to remain positive that these changes will be the driving force for TSW Legends. It being its own game could function similarly to the quite popular Path of Exile (which has shops but shockingly not seen as greedy or P2W, imagine that!), if the story and world narrative plus the investigative puzzles are kept as a core tenet, there is no reason to think this won't be a positive boost. The original TSW wills till be active in maintenance mode, which is a lot more merciful than a lot of developers have done with much healthier MMOs and their shutdowns.All in all, there is no need to be insult-slinging naysayers over a game not even out yet, if it IS indeed as horrible as prematurely stated, one would hope it is reviewed as such after actually having given it a fair shot and played it.(giving a positive in lieu of no neutral option, may change on release)

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Although Funcom sucks bad at making PC games and has no idea how to make one correctly, this is a (despite its numerous technical issues) very original, very fun mmo that is set in the real world. It's game world is very fun to play in. Now that this went subscriptionless, it is definitely worth the one time cost of $30. It breaks away from the monotony that every new MMO brings by being unique in that unlike all other MMO's, it is set in our real world and every horry story is true: secret societies, zombies, vampires, werewolves, illuminati, gay marriage, all the nightmares are real. So unlike games like World of Jack Black Kung Fu Panda Craft, it is not a big looney tunes f--kfest. It also actually makes you use your brain sometimes to figure out tough investigative quests. There are also no levels in the game: you gain ability and skill points to use on upgrading your ability to wear higher quality weapons and armor and to buy new active/passive abilities.The dungeons in the game are the best dungeons I've ever played through in a mmo because of one thing: they don't ♥♥♥♥ around and waste your time. It's straight up boss after boss after boss fight with only a couple of filler mobs in between bosses, but mostly it's just back to back to back bosses. Dungeons are quick and rewarding, the way it should be. No ♥♥♥♥ing around with piddly little who-gives-a-♥♥♥♥ easymode mobs.The biggest drawbacks about the game are that combat is a bit on the generic side, the ability system is awkward and somewhat confusing for quite a while until you get the hang of it and ask a lot of questions about it in general chat, and the game, despite being out over 2 years now, is still buggy. I am always discovering some new bulls--t technical problem with it that I have to email their tech support about. I've never had the kind of odd problems I have with this game with any other game ever before, but they are not deal breaking problems; I can still play the game relatively fine. That is until I hang at a load screen and have to restart the game once in a while. Funcom sucks♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at making pc games... The combat and ability system and technical issues are what I think to be the reasons this game went f2p in a year's time, but it gets a bit more satisfying the deeper you play into the game. The ability wheel system could have been done way better though. Groupmaking could be way better implemented also.Besides that, the reason it is for sure worth playing is everything else it offers. Its real-world setting and original story are a nice fresh take on an otherwise bogged down genre that has become way, way too over-cliched with the fantasy and dragons gimmick. I love fantasy and dragons, but God damn take it easy on that♥♥♥♥♥♥ This game could also be optimized much, much better so it runs better, but does not detract too much from the fun. A nice game, pick it up for some interesting fun. Unless you are an adult toddler queer who likes World of Jack Black School of Rock Kung Fu Panda Big Bird Teletubbies Craft.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 29, 2015
												Unfortunately, I'm going to have to give a thumbs down for this game. I bought it on a discount for something like £18. I thought that was fairly decent for an MMO, they're usually games that soak up playtime like mad. But I regret doing so now.Side note: I am still only in the 'Lovecraft style' zones, so I never got to the end. But a game that won't keep me to the end isn't a game I'd ever recommend.Don't get me wrong, the theme is great. I love the whole urban legend, Lovecraftian, monster-world feel. But the gameplay is just awful. Every single fight is a long, drawn out case of spamming a few buttons. Dodging is alright but it's really just a bit of a gimmick, where most other MMOs will have the same thing of 'get out of the way of attack' without a dodge button.The mission pointer is also frustrating. I had one that pointed me in one direction, only to find it was sending me into primary teleport world (can't remember the name, it's where all the bees come from), to the portal that I hadn't unlocked yet. Other times it's pointed me right into a cliff, or on the wrong side of a building. It also fails to show the '3D' location, so sometimes the point is underground and you're standing above it thinking 'but I'm right where it says I should be'.The missions themselves are just generic quests of go here/kill this/gather these/find this/click this. The only twist they have is that some of them are complicated. They force you to have to look up things, like Bible passages, or co-ordinates, or binary stuff. That sort of thing, where the game alone won't suffice. The clue requires research, which I suppose is in-keeping with this sort of game.But this is where the downside kicks in: the playerbase is small. Which means there aren't a lot of guides out there. If you want to just save time and look something up, chances are you won't find anything about it. It isn't popular enough to actually warrant online activity, so there's not much information out there.What I can say is that this game really isn't very different to most other MMOs. It has the same sorts of quests, the same sorts of combat, the same sorts of interfaces (just re-named to other words to confuse new starters). The same things but they don't do it half as well as other games.Edit: I did miss something quite important. This game is marketed as one without levels or classes. This is actually a falsehood.Levels are still there, you just don't get a number by your character. Instead you get points to spend on upgrading your skills. The higher your level, the more skills you have, the better your character is. In fact, if you don't have enough points in some areas, you can't equip items. Your 'level' is too low for them.Classes are also still there, only they are tied to weapons instead of characters. Each weapon has a different role and has different skills to upgrade. A player can carry multiple weapons (so multiple classes), and if their level is high enough they will have upgraded multiple class lines.That particular dishonesty on the part of Funcom does grind a little bit on me.Edit 2: It's also probably worth mentioning that what few players there are in this game are rabidly fanatical about it. A harmless criticism of the game is equal to a racist killing spree for them. And they group together.Just check out the reviews for a slice of it. Go to positive reviews and look for the lowest rating you can find. Then look for the highest rating you can find in the negative reviews. You'll probably notice that even the lowest positive score will be 15-20% higher than the highest negative score. Why? Because they stick together.It's pretty apt that a game about cults would produce such a cultish mentality in its player base.

												The only modern setting rp. Combat is a mix of action combat with tab targetting. This means you need to face your target for your attack to connect. I highly recommend the game.

												In real life, I have always been fascinated by the dark and the Unknown. You know, the Occult. But, in real life, there is a possibility you could get hurt by delving into the Unknown.The Secret World provides me with the oppurtunity to explore the Unknown unharmed and at a safe distance (behind my computer screen).+ The combat is engaging, immersive and fun.+ There are plenty of conspiracies, monsters, myths, secret socities and puzzles to keep you invested for hours and hours on end.+ The replayability factor is extremely high.+ There are plenty of customization options for clothing, such as hats, jackets, masks and pants/trousers+ You can build the character you want to build, as there are a lot of options you can mix and match within the skill tree- The Starter Character Customization is basic, bland and way too simplified- Not Optomised for low end computers- Can feel like a chore to finish a mission or quest

content:
Posted: January 15
												First off i would like to notice, that i like the premise and the style of this game. A bit gothic, a bit mythology and a bit sci-fi. Feels and looks great... but then the gameplay - especially the comba!Yeah there are no classes and yes you can learn every skill with one character... and while i get that many feel this is the strongest part of the game, to me it's the weakest (or most annoying, to be more precise). How do i explain...? Imagine you got a construction kit for a sword and the manual says "create the ultimate sword of your imagination" and you go  "yeah, let's get this started! Here a bit aluminium, there some carbon and some iron... finished". Then you start combat and your "ideal sword" get's wrecked instantly and you die. So think "hm... well let's start over and be a bit more methodic. Less aluminium, more carbon..." then again combat and while your sword does not break, it's as dull as it could be, does no damage and you get overwhelmed. So once again you start to fumble around with the kit. And again... and again... and again...Seriously, there're a ton of character builds and so many guides on the net. I tried over and over and yet never felt once optimal even though all i wanted was a damage build with shotgun for single target ans AoE-Elementalism. With all the cross-effects between active and passive skills, it gets confusing as HELL.Yes, i appreciate some freedom with my character-developement but when i can't even create an effective DD or Tank, then f*** this!And using the 1-7 number keys for a dynamic-combat-system is less than optimal. For exampel, Neverwinter's controls hold up a lot better. Furthermore, even though the Maps are huge, there are no mounts (except for those expensive ones in the ingame-shop) and no kind of fast-travel. Going from a to b  gets tiresome as hell. And with all those "wheret he f*** do i go" kind of quests, this game burned me out really fast. Sad, because i wanted to get into it... but every time i try, it takes about an hour and i'm pi**** off as hell. SO if you (like me) want some kind of red thread in your game, this is nothing for you.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												So, you choose the Asians, the Americans, or the Europeans.Then you spend 50+ hours trying to stop Loki from destroying the [secret] world with his keyblade.  After that, the setting, VA, and writing lessen in strength.It avoids many typical MMORPG conventions to give itself a niche and maintain freshness, but your mileage may vary.  The focus is more-so on gear and character building rather than leveling up, and you can change anything you want about your character at any given time.  Except: for your hair and face you'll need to see a barber and a plastic surgeon, respectively.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 14, 2015
												On of the best MMO's in the universe. Past. Present. Future.The team behind the longest journey franchise.The writing is truly superb...some of the best i have seen in a video game.The  atmosphere is really astounding.It's pretty creepy form time to time too.There are these special missions called investigation missions...i love them...i really, really love this game. it's for hardcore rpg enthusiasts though, probably...if you like tabletop rpg's and you like call of chtulhu? this is basically that, only in 3D.EDIT!!!So I decided to venture back into Agartha and the universe of the Secret World.And this is what i have discovered thus far.It's been ca three years scince i last played this game, and...well, the bugs i encountered back then are still rampant. with some additional ones, it seems.nothing directly game-breaking though, at least not too much, but the 4th wall is being broken all over the place.missing textures, windows freezing up, dialogue options locked and frozen solid, the same odd look of the textures of a characters skin and sometimes they even have 4 eyes...weapons go completely black because of lack of textures. so you see, some serious texture problems in here, and guess what, they we're present three years ago. also there are some serious, SERIOUS latency and framerate issues. and what do you know, they we're there at launch. so obviously nothing has been touched or refined scince, at least, the effort was a waste, because nothing has changed.i know that they have been adding some content to the game, but come one, how about cleaning out the trash before you horde in new stuff? i don't know...seems lazy, and though i do not know the intricacies going on at the company (funcom) these days, and even though i ardently believed in them...it doesn't seem strange to me at all right now that the company if unravelling at the seems. the fundation was obviously poorly built, and thus, the building crumbles.all of this is a great shame. because the game has such incredible potential. It's the most unique mmorpg out there. with a heavy lovecraftian atmosphere and story, highly intelligent and crafty writing and some really great concepts and designs. i still love it...because it's redeeming features thankfully outnumbers the grotesque listlesness of the development team in regards to fixing things.having said all this, i still claim that this is one of the greatest mmo's out there, and even one of the most unique and interesting games of all time. so should you still play it? definitely.the bugs can be ignored, and the beauty of it absorbed. but if you are not into dark lovecraftian lore and stories of the grave...you might not be able to abide all the bugs.if you want to play a truly amazing and huge lovecraftian (how many times have i written lovecraftian at this point?) universe where all deep things sealed in ancient tombs have been unsealed, with some incredibly fun investigation missions, something that i completely unique in the mmo genre as a whole, then yes. buy it, and play it forever.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Ok, how to put this, Ive been playing for over 200 hours now throughout the course of a year.  I say give it a chance especially when you get over $150 worth in content for $20 or even $60 when there is no sale, still worth it considering the price of each issue and side quest pack alone being almost $10-15.  This is how it works. There is no official class system, get used to it, you will never be successful using just one build literally.  You can solo the story content with the right builds, Pvp is decent, they have your straight Deathmatch, to capture points of interest to gain points, if your faction wins a Pvp match, you get a buff, World domination is key for a nice buff. The story is great, when i watch people on twitch who have never played skip some cutscenes, i laugh because its not that simple if your the type who doesnt use guides, the game is much more fun if you play it and actually figure the puzzles out for yourself, they even have an in-game browser, which for people running two monitors, doesnt matteer much, but still nice, add-ons become dam near essential later so pick up some mods when you start getting to the beef of the game, dungeons. Dungeons start like normal, though not centralized around dungeons or raids, they are practically necessary end game, because of the drops. I wouldnt be able to even put a dent in how much content there is in a short paragraph or two.  Lore is damn near endless and increasing, with the release of issue 13 in December 2015, you can tell Funcom does not ♥♥♥♥ around with this game, yes there are minor bugs here and there especially with one of the cutscenes in blue mountain the horror of this girls face is just awful lol her mouth is off set, but regardless, the game itself is not nice to people who think they can pull mobs and gain a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of xp, nono the game is much harder than you think, there are viable builds that can last throughout the game and there are ♥♥♥♥♥♥ builds like really why would you think thatd be good? But experiment with it, try making your own build after you read up on how penetration is almost the most essential for dps builds in the beginning, and how some specs like physical and magical defense are♥♥♥♥♥♥no matter what you try to accomplish lol.  As i said before i have not even scraped the surface of how big this game is, it starts slow, and progressively gets better.

The more I play, the more I'm drawn into learning more about it's mysterious and intriguing storyline.  I came back to this game after not having played it for about a year now and I can honestly say that I'm still having a blast picking up right where I left off.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												My experience with this game is mostly positive, as a player of MMOs I have a good sense of what games should get right and what games do wrong. The good: This game is the best-looking, immersive, interactive games I have ever seen. Interaction goes way beyond interacting with objects and pushing buttons. It forces you to find clues and think like a supernatural investigator would. The leveling system is revolutionary, no other MMO lets you put points into skills this way. It's awesome.The Bad: It can be confusing at times. New players may not know what to do and have to feel around slowly at first. As you gain confidence, you get bolder and bolder, solving puzzles and finding secrets.The ugly: avoiding taking damage and aggroing patrolling mobs. Avoiding taking damage without aggroing non-target mobs is difficult and can cause wipes. The  mantra of "the only way to stop incoming damage is dealing more damage" only works in MMOs where you're sure you can put out more damage than your target. In an MMO where there are no Experience Levels, this can be difficult.Other thoughts: This game is very unique, features a customizable character thing, and lets you indulge in supernatural settings thought long lost. The investigative side reminds me of watching X-Files episodes, and some of the missions make me feel like I'm in a movie, scavenging supplies, forming a plan, and taking the fight to the bad guys. The best part is that it still is fun to me.

content:
Posted: April 25
Product received for free
												I don't normally leave reviews for games (even ones I extremely hate; looking at you Dementium II), but since this game has been catching a lot of flack for some drastic development choices lately, I decided to give my own two cents. So here we go:(Please note this is mostly my review for the TSW base game with a few of my opinions for the upcoming remake. As for Funcom carrying over positive reviews from TSW to SWL, it hasn't even been established whether they will delete them all upon release or not. I think saying they're trying to deceive consumers on something that hasn't even been released yet is jumping to conslusions. If deceit is actually occurring, I do not condone it, but as of right now, without knowing the full scope of the situation, I will remain positive on the matter. It's not like anyone can buy the game right now anyway. Funcom at least had the decency to remove the ability to purchase the base game, so nobody would continue to spend money a soon-to-be defunct product.)I am fairly new to The Secret World, but I'm glad I was able to play a bit of the base game before Secret World Legends came out. I've been enjoying TSW greatly and although the gameplay can be janky at times, I've so far enjoyed it more than the last MMO I attempted to play. (I'm really glad that TSW doesn’t have a lot of lengthy back-tracking along with no ungodly long skill rotations.) The storylines in TSW are interesting and the large variety of enemies you can combat is very satisfying. Most, if not all, the characters are voiced (by very well-picked voice actors) and they are very entertaining to interact with. The ability of solo play and the freedom to choose whatever weapons and skills you want while not being restricted to a class is also very welcomed and appreciated. Overall, The Secret World universe exploits a lot a lot of the niches and themes I enjoy very much and blends them together in a new and unique way so it really is sort of a dream game come true for me; I really don't know why I haven't tried playing it sooner.As for Secret World Legends, I am actually looking forward to it. I am following  SWL's development fairly closely, and it seems like most of the changes are improvements on the base game. The Funcom dev team seems very competent and it looks like they know what they want to achieve to make the game more enjoyable as a whole for both new and veteran players alike. The main change I'm personally looking forward to is improved gameplay; the new reticle system looks like it removes a lot of previously-mentioned jank of the base game. There will also be a legitimate dressing room mechanic so you can see all the cosmetics on your character better. The only thing I'm a bit leery on so far is the use of keys to unlock chests in dungeons, but it's been said that you will get free keys daily and that you can also buy them with in-game currency, so I don't think that will be too big of a deal in that case. The skill wheel also seems like it will be simplified for ease of use while still allowing enough freedom to create your own unique build. I personally would recommend looking into the details that have already been released about SWL to form your own opinion before jumping to conclusions about the Free-to-Play formula. The Funcom Twitch streams certainly clear up a lot of the misconceptions and share some helpful insight on what to expect, so checking in on those is also highly recommended. (Also, check on them because Andy the community manager is a beautiful human being. Never change Andy.) If you also watch the streams when they’re live, there’s even a chance you could win a beta key to Secret World Legends in a raffle, so hey, you could potentially be awarded for taking the time to look into the development.I feel like I should also mention that I actually got The Secret World as a gift from a friend. I wouldn't shut up about how cool the game looked but I was unsure if I should buy it after my sort of "meh" experience with the last MMO I tried. Turns out, he purchased it for me like a week or less before SWL was announced and before the ability to purchase the base game from Steam was removed. At first he was a bit disheartened that he wasted money because SWL will be F2P but, after further research, it has been stated that returning players will receive rewards for owning and playing the base game (along with its DLCs), and most of the cosmetic items from the base game will be carried over. My friend only bought me the main game (without the DLCs), but I did plan on upgrading to the Ultimate or Complete edition later. It looks like I won't have to do that now, but I would have definitely done so if SWL wasn't announced. IF I play SWL (either in beta or when it comes out completely) and my opinion changes or if Funcom *is* actually trying to deceive by review swapping, I will either change or remove this review, but for now, I’m mostly happy with what I see so far.So, for anyone who has read to this point, I hope my overly long review helped some and I thank you for taking the time to read. I wish you all a good day and happy hunting.

content:
Posted: March 30
												The original version of this game is/was one of my favorite games of all time, as my playtime would indicate. It had one of the best stories and communities ever, and took me from playing single player games only into the world of MMOs. I made many friends, killed thousands of monsters, and served as an officer in one of the game's largest guilds for a time. The original developers truly made something special in creating The Secret World.As for SW: Legends, only time will tell, but I am not holding my breath. I strongly disapprove of their actions in porting in the old reviews onto a new game, and what I am seeing thus far in rolling out the "revamp." Unless Funcom does anything to indicate that they will value their story, their community, and honest business practices moving forward, I do not plan to spend any time or money on their games ever again.

Posted: January 13, 2016
												*My review was marked as "not helpful" about 1 minute after I posted it, seems like the devs like to mark negative reviews as "not helpful" as soon as they appear so they don't show up by default on the store page*My experience playing TSW:-Buy game-Install game-Run game, it keeps minimizing-Run game in window to stop it from minimizing-Try to click "create character" but can't, realize that mouse pointer is offset from actual mouse click by about 500 pixels-Run game in borderless window as admin, mouse finally works-Create account, create character, get intrigued with genuinely interesting story and lore-Start playing, realize controls are a pile of ♥♥♥♥-Spend a half hour configuring controls so they feel more organic and natural-When using mouse targeting, aimpoint spazzes out randomly and constantly moves to the left slowly-Google the issue, learn that I have to enable some DPI setting in the compatibility tab of the .exe properties menu-Realize targeting with the mouse is useless unless you have one of those mice with like 200 buttons on them for macros because even though you have guns, you have to use like 6 different keys to shoot them-Play through 20 min and get to the part where you pick weapons for your character-Pick pistol and try out assault rifle-Game bugs out and won't let me progress because the mission requirements keep resetting after you complete them-Quit & reload game to see if I can go back or get around it, nope-Realize I probably have to create a new character for this, and you only get 3-Raged-Uninstalled-Refunded (first refund EVER)this game seems super cool and would be fun if it was actually functional. genuinely disappointed that it sucks cos it seemed really deep and interesting.2/10, not even worth $5

												Expect to be offered incentives to 'continue the story' only to discover that there is a huge hole in the progression tree for the story between zones 3 and 4, which you will have to then buy extra 'side' content to progress through, or play dungeons over and over for gear grinding.If you like grinding continually, get the game. Again and again and again.Game left me feeling I'm out of pocket for gameplay I can't access, while competing MMOs with similar business models are far more welcoming.Unless you absolutely love the setting, take your money elsewhere.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2016
												I want to love this game. I REALLY do. And it provides so many amazing ideas about how MMOs could work. Integrating the real world in a semi-ARG is phenomenal. The setting of modern day instead of medieval fantasy is a brilliant move. Limiting quests and abilities is such a great design even if it seems counter-intuitive at first. But I just can't recommend it. There are so many problems from unclear storytelling to a really bad UI that it makes the game too difficult to enjoy. Ultimately it's a fantastic single-player investigation game wrapped in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ MMO. Many people would love it, really, but most will not. I recommend you try it at least, because it really is worth it. Any attempt to change what we believe MMOs are supposed to do is worth it, IMO. But as it stands, I just can't recommend it to the general public.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												I realize that I have very little playtime in this game, but I really didn't need to for this review.   The gameplay is just...clunky. The character model moves around like an older, boxy game, when the game is clearly trying to be more. Although the gameplay videos make the combat look smooth, and smash-em-uppy, it's not. It's still the same tired old "circle around the enemy" formula. The game even has a targeting mode, which makes it to where you don't have to hold your mouse button down, and it gives you crosshairs, but it seems like the innovation for combat stopped there because they didn't do anything with it. Once in combat mode, my mouse buttons are useless (why can't I reassign combat buttons differently from non-combat controls?), and it basically just targets the closest thing most times, or in the case of you having a weapon that has a range on it, the furthest enemy possible so your attacks wont work. Lets not mention the whole micro transaction thing, and the fact that they're running a campaign on "pay once play forever" thing, but you have to pay more to advance and get more episodes to the story. Let me give a tip to any game developers reading this about micro transactions: DON'T CHARGE PLAYERS TO ADVANCE IN YOUR GAME. Charge me for cosmetics if you have to (and people will buy the absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥out of cosmetics, i.e. every MOBA out right now), but don't charge me to keep playing your game, just because you came out with a bit more content.I really thought this game had potential, and when I saw it on a steam sale I grabbed it out of impulse. I'm regretting my purchase now, and refunding.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												The Secret World is difficult for me to recommend or not recommend, because its an interesting game to say the least. Overall, its a wonderful game, with terrific story and writing, great atmosphere, beautiful and creepy locales, wonderful voice acting in places you wouldn't normally expect any voice acting at all, and some great quests, including some genius investigation quests that sometimes require going outside the game to look for clues at fake websites made for the game. The problem with it is that its a lackluster MMO. Everything that makes an MMO good (in my opinion at least) is lacking. The community just isn't there for the most part, even on the most populated servers. Even if you can manage to get enough people to do a dungeon with, none of the different traditional MMO roles of tank, healer or dps feel that fun to play as, and everyone else is rushing through the dungeon so fast you cant even catch the story that frames what you're doing in the dungeon in the first place. I never got into endgame content but it doesn't sound much better. Some people say theres grinding involved, but I never got to that point. Never tried PvP because I never got geared enough to be able to compete, which is pretty crappy in itself. The Secret World is a great singleplayer game for the most part (combat feels a bit tedious, but I blame that mostly because its an MMO), and luckily most of the game can be played and enjoyed solo. But as an MMO, it just doesn't do it for me. So if you're looking for a fun single player experience and can deal with some tedious combat, I would recommend this game. But if you're looking for a good MMO to play, skip it.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												At first, I did recommend this game, with a "warning" about some aspects. However, as I poured more time into it, those aspects become more and more frustrating to the point that I doubt I will spend much more time playing this.Firstly, it handles fine. Combat is interesting, with different branching pathways and such.The community is very nice, and willing to help new players. The lore is great. This is one of the very few mmo's I've played where quests are completed more for LORE's sake, then for the experience or item rewards.What ultimately killed this game for me, was the guides. And Walkthroughs. Ultimately, I spent more time browsing the internet, looking at detailed walkthroughs/build guides/storyline guides to see what areas I should go to next, that in a 4 hour period of playing the game, I spent 3 hours of that looking at guides, with 1 hour of actual play time. That's not enjoyable to me. It killed any sense of enjoyment, of desire to keep playing.If you don't mind doing a LOT of research, then this will probably be fine for you. For me, personally, it gives me a splitting headache to try to play this for any length of time.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												i've played this one off and on for a few weeks, delving into it enough to ensure i hadn't wasted my money. The game itself is different than any other MMO i've played in the aspect of it's puzzles. Some of these are literally undoable unless you google the answer (which they actually tell you to do,even call the quest a "google quest") or if you happen to be a brain.Now in my opinion  that isn't a bad thing, it's a new form of challenge and a game without challenge gets boring easy.Gameplay itself is pretty nice. Not class based whatsoever. The weapons you equip decide your skills and there are many skills to unlock. If you get tired of a weapon and want another, you can switch anytime you want. You aren't restrticted.  You'll find out pretty fast the best gear comes from dungeons  (as with most games) but the playerbase is pretty low so finding a group for the dungeon can be difficult sometimes although i have to say the community is very nice. There is usually someone willing to run newbies through dungeons just for the sake of entertainment. Armor doesn't affect style. You can wear what stats you want while wearing a cosmetic style over it. Character creation is pretty lame. Not many choices to pick from and no long hair choices at all...well they say long hair but it's shoulder length..That's about as much as i can say as i'm still pretty new to the game still.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
												This game is seriously THE BEST mmo game I've ever played and honestly mmo games USUALLY turn me off badly. The story in the beginning with the bug (literal), that freaky dream, then you with your powers, thats something you won't get to revisit unless you create a new character. The Three Story Arcs depends on the Faction you choose, but take a big note; There are NO Classes & seriously, NO levels. Don't bother creating a new character cause you THINK you screwed up, cause you CAN unlock every single skill in the game on just ONE character - How you design your character's build? 100% up to you.Now there's a number of things you SHOULDN'T expect from this game:1) For it to be Easy - if you're expecting that, you'll rage quit pretty quickly, this game is NOT easy at the start. First you have to build your character's abilities & create the best build suited for you, once you have it figured out & that'll take a while, THEN it might become easy (at least til you get to the harder areas).2) You wiped them out easily the first dozen times, next you change your build, you expect things to be the same - No, you change your character & you alter your pros & cons. Sometimes you'll find build set that feels better, just be sure it is better against everything.3) You expect to be a Legend real quick - Sorry, but thats not gonna happen. Maybe much later in the game, but not immediately after you start. There is no rush, pace yourself, and be smart. Otherwise, you could easily get yourself killed quick.4) You grinded on WoW an rose fast, this is no different - Actually it IS different. All enemies have difficulty tags, and they only change based on your build set & Quality Level (QL) of your gear. If you're expecting to slaughter Red Skull enemies (to WoW that's equivalent to Elites), you'll be slaughtered, also you won't gain much anyways - you'll spending most of your money on repairs than the loot these enemies will drop. 5) All MMOs are the same - Not all, sure there are many out there that are just copy & paste, but this game IS different. 90% of MMOs have Classes (Fighter, Archer, Mage, etc), Secret World has NONE. Most MMOs will restrict you because of your level, Secret World has NO Levels and lets you play any quest you want even if there's no possible way you could beat that quest, they'll still let you try. Most MMOs restrict abilities based on Classes, Secret World doesn't have that restriction, you can be ANYTHING you want and can use EVERY SINGLE SKILL in the game.This game is like Dark Souls in terms of heavy hitting enemies with very different abilities meant to destroy you. Even simple zombies if you're not careful or you're overconfident could easily overwhelm you. Many quests are pretty straight forward & direct, others expect you to literally use your brain cells & quick thinking, while some others require perfect stealth to get the best rewards. This game is also like EVE Online in terms of intricate character designs, great stories, and fully customizable ability sets  (heck you can even use a Passive ability from a Melee set to buff an Active ability from a Magic set - I'm not joking an yes it does work). Big Plus: Celebrity Voice Acting. EVERYTHING is voice acted! Such as: Laura Aikman, Jimmy Akingbola, Ben Aldridge, Adjoa Andoh, Leigh-Allyn Baker, Tara Lynne Barr, Tim Bentinck, Brian Bloom, Steve Blum, Steffan Boje, Nicholas Boulton, Bertie Carvel, Jeffrey Combs (Frighteners & Deep Space Nine), Jonathan Espolin-Johnson, Christopher Fairbank (Alien 3), Christopher Fairbank (Mass Effect 2 as Warlord Okeer), Camilla Frey, David Hoffman, Bob Joles, Irwin Keyes, Andrew Kishino (BulletStorm), C.S. Lee (Dexter tv show), William Mapother (LOST as Ethan Rom), Jenny O'Hara (Wishmaster), Tim Russ (Voyager as Lt Tuvok), Armin Shimerman (Deep Space Nine as Quark), André Sogliuzzo (Transformers Revenge Fallen as Sideswipe), Dennis Storhøi (13th Warrior), Peter Stormare (8MM as Dino Velvet), and many others.- Yes, you can invade Hell an you will feel like you walked in to DOOM's version of Hell. - Yes, you can not only fight the Deep Ones, but even Cthulhu himself!- Yes, you can join The Templars, The Illuminati, or The Dragon (not literal flying beast dragon, basically a Chinese Triad who is just as dangerous as the other two).- Yes, you can craft your own weapons, gear, and Glyphs (equivalent to Diablo's Runes).- What if you unlock every single skill? There's still more! You can augment your skills to make you character even more deadly & powerful, plus there's the Auxiliary Weapons (special very powerful weapons that will make your character even more unique & unstoppable depending on your build). - What if you want you character to look like a bad♥♥♥♥♥ Yup you can definitely do that, every faction has their own Faction Uniforms and you can buy other cosmetic outfits anywhere in the game. - Want to replay a quest to build up your character? Do it as much as you want (of course there is a cooldown), replay a quest however many times as you please an you'll still get experience for skills & loot regardless of how powerful you are.- Not liking the interface or something in the game is bothering you? Mods are fully supported in the game to alter the UIs and even make things easier to adjust, make quests easier to find, auto-upgrade your stuff, disassemble loot for you, help make crafting stuff easier, even mods to help you build a powerful character, yeah Funcom, the owners of the game fully support mods. Of course if you get/create a mod that acts like a cheat, those will not work (even if you somehow do get them to work, the cheat mod, Funcom can just as easily ban you, so don't try it).There's honestly too many awesome things that make this game THE BEST out there.I've played WoW, EVE Online, Guild Wars, ARK Survival Evolved, Warframe, Rift, Requiem Memento Mori, I lost interest in all of them - Secret World is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!!

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												You find this written in micrographia on the side of a fire hydrant: "File of cleric ran for pie sideways with a broken, bloody proboscis and nearby found the stars.""File of cleric" is an anagram of "Circle of life," indicating that you need to walk counter-clockwise while quoting from the Necronomicon. "Circle of life" is also the first song on The Lion King soundtrack, and if we look at the 3rd letter in its lyrics (which is an o) and chop off 10% of it (thus giving us the 3.1 of pi) and turn it sideways it becomes a u. This tells us that we need to use an emote which has only now, and without announcement, been made available to us (/u) which contorts our avatar into the foetal position (also a u shape). If we then follow the direction in which our avatar's nose (proboscis) is pointing and drop all of our money (thus making us broke) at the end of the map, a vendor will materialise from the ether and hand us a scandalous article from a celeb (star) worship magazine, on which we need to wipe our blood. Given the scandalous nature of the article we have bloodied, this brings to mind "blood libel" indicating that we need to then translate the article into Hebrew. At this point the next clue in our investigation quest will have become apparent.If this (lack of) logic does not appeal to you and you don't get off on repetitive, undercooked combat, do not buy this game.
